{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Elon Musk is reportedly pushing his team to boost production to hit a 'tough' but historic milestone — building half a million cars in one year","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-is-pushing-to-build-500000-vehicles-this-year-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f51562de6ff30001d4e6fb4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elon Musk wears mask at Berlin meeting\" height=\"1661\" width=\"2215\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>&#34;It will be tough but super exciting if we can exceed 500,000 cars made in a single year for the first time in Tesla history,&#34; Elon Musk told his staff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tobias Schwarz/Pool via REUTERS</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Elon Musk sent an email to his employees laying out an ambitious goal: building 500,000 vehicles in 2020.&#160;</li>\n<li>Tesla needs to produce 170,000 vehicles in the fourth quarter &#8212; a 17% increase over Q3 &#8212; to reach that mark.</li>\n<li>Musk's email comes after Tesla <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-beats-expectations-for-third-quarter-vehicle-deliveries-2020-10\">topped</a> analyst expectations for third-quarter vehicle deliveries.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Elon Musk has never shied away from aggressive goals — and never hesitated to push those around him to help make them happen. For his latest would-be coup, the Tesla CEO wants to ramp up fourth quarter production by 17% compared to the third quarter, so Tesla can hit a milestone.&#160;</p><p>\"It will be tough but super exciting if we can exceed 500,000 cars made in a single year for the first time in Tesla history,\" Musk told his staff <a href=\"https://electrek.co/2020/10/07/tesla-tsla-increase-production-elon-musk-leak-email/\">in an email reported by Electrek</a>. \"It all comes down to Q4. Please take whatever steps you can think of to improve output (while increasing quality).\"</p><p>Musk's email comes after Tesla <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-beats-expectations-for-third-quarter-vehicle-deliveries-2020-10\">topped</a> analyst expectations for third-quarter vehicle deliveries on Friday. The company delivered 139,300 vehicles during that time frame, just beating estimates of 134,720. Tesla has produced 330,000 vehicles throughout the first three quarters of this year, meaning it has to crank out another 170,000 to satisfy the CEO. (Tesla did not reply to Business Insider's request for comment.)</p><p>The good Q3 numbers were the result of high <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-beats-expectations-for-third-quarter-vehicle-deliveries-2020-10\">demand</a> for the Model Y sport utility vehicle and Model 3 sedan, which represented&#160;124,100 deliveries. Tesla also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-second-quarter-q2-earnings-profit-revenue-sales-elon-musk-2020-7\">beat</a> Wall Street expectations in the second quarter, reporting its&#160;fourth consecutive quarter of profit — a company record.</p><p>\"We believe the progress we made in the first half of this year has positioned us for a successful second half of 2020,\" Tesla <a href=\"https://ir.tesla.com/static-files/f41f4254-f1cc-4929-a0b6-6623b00475a6\">noted</a> in a financial update. \"Production output of our existing facilities continues to improve to meet demand, and we are adding more capacity.\"</p><p>On September 28, Musk <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-tesla-berlin-shanghai-factories-will-design-build-original-cars-2020-9\">confirmed</a> that Tesla eventually plans to design and manufacture new and differing car models at Gigafactory Shanghai and Berlin. This provided a glimpse of how Musk envisions Tesla's roadmap for its extended and continuously growing supply chain.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-is-pushing-to-build-500000-vehicles-this-year-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a into &#34;Hannity&#34; on Fox News\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fox News</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump interrupted himself during a call-in interview on Fox News Thursday night to clear his throat to the point of a stifled cough.</li>\n<li>Host Sean Hannity did not acknowledge the moment and kept the interview moving.</li>\n<li>Hannity did ask Trump how he was doing following his discharge from the hospital with COVID-19, and Trump said he was feeling \"really great.\"</li>\n<li>Trump also announced his plans to hold a rally \"probably in difficulty speaking at one point during his call-in interview on Fox News Thursday night, clearing his throat to the point of a stifled cough before the sound cut out, leading to a pause lasting several seconds.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Aaron Rupar  (@atrupar) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1314380019146412034?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 9, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Trump announced nearly a week ago (early Friday, October 2) that he and First Lady Melania Trump tested positive for COVID-19. Trump spent several days at Walter Reed Medical Center for testing and treatment due to the virus.&#160;</p><p>On Thursday, Trump told Hannity that he was doing \"great,\" but dodged questions about if he had recently been, saying he would be tested tomorrow.</p><p>The last time Trump said he tested negative for COVID-19 was in May, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/white-house-wont-say-when-trump-was-last-tested-2020-10\">the White House has been refusing to say</a> when his last negative test was.</p><p>\"The test will be tomorrow — the actual test, because there's no need to test all the time,\" Trump said.</p><p>Elsewhere in the interview, Trump announced his plans to hold a MAGA rally \"probably in Florida\" this Saturday night. He also floated having another in Pennsylvania afterwards, though it remains unclear whether he is still contagious with a highly contagious deadly disease.</p><p>Trump also cleared his throat later in the interview when talking about how \"absentee ballots are fine.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Aaron Rupar 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"US stocks rise as investors weigh latest comments on stimulus progress","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-indexes-reaction-stimulus-talks-jobless-claims-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f62310f9900001939ee64?format=jpeg\" alt=\"worried trader\" height=\"2880\" width=\"5760\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Moore/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks gained on Thursday on revived hopes for near-term stimulus and on jobless claims that declined week-over-week.</strong></li><li><strong>President Donald Trump indicated in a tweet late Tuesday that he backed a piecemeal strategy for passing smaller stimulus measures. </strong></li><li><strong>The news boosted equities Thursday morning, but indexes pared gains after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi indicated she would only back smaller bills alongside a larger stimulus package.</strong></li><li><strong>New US jobless claims for the week that ended on Saturday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-jobless-claims-weekly-unemployment-insurance-benefits-hiring-economic-recovery-2020-10\">totaled 840,000</a>, above the median economist estimate of 820,000 claims but a slight decline from the prior week.</strong></li><li><strong>Oil prices climbed amid concerns that Hurricane Delta will slow output in the Gulf region. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> gained as much as 3,5%, to $41.33 per barrel.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/indices\">Watch major indexes update live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>US equities rose on Thursday as investors digested the latest updates to a possible near-term stimulus measure.</p><p>President Donald Trump signaled late Tuesday that he would support a piecemeal approach to new fiscal relief, mentioning the Paycheck Protection Program, airline aid, and another round of direct payments.&#160;The president's tweets revived hopes for fresh government support and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-dow-sp500-gain-renewed-stimulus-hopes-2020-10-1029659017\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">drove stocks higher</a> on Wednesday.</p><p>Yet indexes pared gains after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she wouldn't support an individual airline relief bill unless it was part of a larger package.&#160;Democrats have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/standalone-stimulus-bills-trump-republicans-low-odds-success-pelosi-opposition-2020-10\">previously balked at standalone bills</a>, and the party is set to back its own $2.2 trillion measure over Republicans' piecemeal approach.</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at the 4 p.m. ET market close on Thursday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,446.83, up 0.8%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestmp;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a>:</strong> 28,425.51, up 0.4% (122 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestmp;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 11,420.98, up 0.5%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trading-strategy-legend-richard-dennis-shares-secrets-rules-to-millions-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Self-taught market wizard Richard Dennis took a $1600 loan and turned it into an estimated $200 million. He shares the 13 trading rules that turned his performance parabolic.</a></em></p><p>Investors might be placing too much faith in Washington to get a deal done \"given the Democrats' reluctance previously to engage in a watered-down approach,\" said Craig Erlam, a senior market analyst at Oanda Europe. But he added that <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/fed-kashkari-warns-enormous-consequences-without-congress-us-stimulus-2020-10-1029658026\">warnings from Federal Reserve officials</a> and other economists suggested they might feel enough pressure to act.</p><p>US jobless claims for the week that ended on Saturday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-jobless-claims-weekly-unemployment-insurance-benefits-hiring-economic-recovery-2020-10\">came in at 840,000</a>, the Labor Department said Thursday. While that was a decline from the prior week's revised figure, it was above the consensus economist forecast of 820,000 claims.</p><p>Continuing claims, a measure that tracks Americans currently receiving unemployment benefits, fell to 11 million for the week that ended on September 26. That was better than economists' forecasts of 11.4 million.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-21-companies-for-strong-sales-growth-goldman-sachs-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Goldman Sachs says to buy these 21 stocks poised to deliver the strongest sales growth through year-end</a></em></p><p>\"The trend in cases appears to have flattened again, but we just don't know which way the numbers will move next,\" Ian Shepherdson, the chief economist at Pantheon Macroeconomics, said in a note. \"If cooler weather pushes infections up again as people move indoors, the very modest decline in jobless claims could easily become a renewed spike.\"</p><p>Airline stocks rebounded on hopes that a $25 billion aid measure could keep the companies from laying off tens of thousands of workers. The group retraced some gains after Pelosi threw cold water on the stimulus optimism.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/regn-stock\">Regeneron</a> soared after Trump praised the company's experimental coronavirus drug as \"key\" to his speedy recovery. In a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1313959702104023047?s=20\">tweet</a> on Wednesday, the president highlighted plans to fast-track the drug's approval for public use.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marijuana-stocks-curaleaf-canopy-growth-surge-as-harris-touts-decriminalization-2020-10\">Weed stocks including Curaleaf and Aurora Cannabis ripped higher</a> after Sen. Kamala Harris endorsed decriminalizing marijuana during her Wednesday night debate with Vice President Mike Pence.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-value-investing-strategy-from-fund-manager-david-herro-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">David Herro has steered the $22.2 billion Oakmark International fund through 5 crises since its inception 28 years ago. The veteran investor shares 3 stocks he's betting on, and the pandemic-related opportunities he's seizing.</a></em></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ibm-stock-price-plans-spin-off-legacy-business-focus-cloud-2020-10\">IBM leaped</a>&#160;after announcing plans to spin off its managed-infrastructure business as a separate public company next year in a tax-free deal for IBM shareholders.</p><p>Spot gold hovered just below $1,900 per ounce after briefly retaking the key support level at intraday highs.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> jumped above its own support of $40 per barrel as traders prepared for Hurricane Delta to curb production in the Gulf region. The precious resource gained as much as 3.4%, to $41.33 per barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestarkets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brent crude</a>, oil's international standard, rose 3.5%, to $43.46 per barrel, at intraday highs.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-investing-advice-stimulus-talks-sector-impact-david-bahnsen-2020-10\" negotiations doesn't threaten the economic recovery</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a global GDP forecast but warns of 'difficult climb' ahead</a></strong></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VqItw2OAcYA\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 08 Oct 2020 20:34:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7f639a0f9900001939ee6d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a8234aad945866c19c689d80effaa08b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn32@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-22-837_06d49de2b5f9ab26.webp","destWidth":5119,"destHeight":3840,"sourceBytes":307672,"destBytes":307672,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7f62310f9900001939ee64?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VqItw2OAcYA:A1bWH9Cyuzg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn80@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-33-468_17d601d74fd759ce.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VqItw2OAcYA:A1bWH9Cyuzg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn96@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-31-614_ca25d5a72d344431.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VqItw2OAcYA:A1bWH9Cyuzg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn91@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-27-885_e6589ab738edf39c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VqItw2OAcYA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-29-264_29458e7ca5835b8d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360909},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Here's how much of a hit Biden's presidential chances would take from a Comey-like October surprise","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-a-comey-letter-like-surprise-would-impact-bidens-campaign-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7de4c8282c500018c791c7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Comey biden and obama\" height=\"1742\" width=\"3485\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US President Barack Obama speaks about the investigation into the mass shooting in Orlando, Florida during a meeting with top officials, including US Vice President Joe Biden (2nd L), Secretary of Homeland Security Jeh Johnson (L) and FBI Director James Comey (R), in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC, June 13, 2016.\n<p class=\"copyright\">SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>About a week before the 2016 election, former FBI Director James Comey sent a letter to Congress alerting them to \"the existence of emails that appear to be pertinent to the investigation\" of Hillary Clinton's private email server.</li>\n<li>According to FiveThirtyEight's Nate Silver, the Comey letter cost Clinton 4 percentage points of support in key states and nearly 2 points nationally.</li>\n<li>If a similar event were to happen to Democratic nominee Joe Biden, he is still projected to lead President Donald Trump nationally and in most of the tipping point states.</li>\n<li>Due to much higher rates of early and mail-in voting in 2020, the chances of an event upending Biden's campaign decrease as it nears Election Day.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Former FBI Director James Comey sent a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-james-comey-letter-clinton-email-investigation-2016-10\">letter to Congress</a> on October 28, 2016 revealing \"the existence of emails that appear to be pertinent to the investigation\" of Hillary Clinton's private email server.</p><p>Clinton's popular vote forecast was narrowing as the election drew closer, but Comey's letter may have affected the voting margin by up to 4 percentage points in the most important states of the race and close to 2 percentage points nationally, according to a <a href=\"https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/the-comey-letter-probably-cost-clinton-the-election/\">report</a> by Nate Silver, founder of <a href=\"https://fivethirtyeight.com/\">FiveThirtyEight</a>, a poll analysis website.</p><p>If a similar event were to involve Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, his projected positive voting margins would shrink, but not enough to ruin his chances in key tipping point states, FiveThirtyEight projected.</p><p>The seven states with the highest chance of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-top-states-which-could-decide-biden-trump-presidential-election-2020\">nudging a candidate</a> over the 270 electoral vote mark are Pennsylvania, Florida, Wisconsin, Michigan, Arizona, North Carolina, and Minnesota,&#160;<a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/\">FiveThirtyEight forecasting shows</a>. In 2016, President Donald Trump won all of these states except Minnesota, which Clinton claimed by <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2016/11/08/500927768/2016-presidential-election-results-for-each-state\">about 2 percentage points</a>.</p><p>An event with the same impact as Comey's letter would reduce Biden's projected lead in Pennsylvania, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pennsylvania-is-the-most-important-state-on-the-map-now-2020-10\">a state the former vice president absolutely needs to flip</a>, from 5.6 to 1.6 percentage points, according to <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/pennsylvania/\">projected voting margins</a> from FiveThirtyEight. His estimated share of the national popular vote would then lead Trump by just 1.8 percentage points.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"The possible effects of a \"Comey letter\" incident happening in 2020  n 2020  \" aria-label=\"chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-KDsRb\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/KDsRb/3/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"481\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><p>With 29 electoral votes, Florida has the most electoral votes of any state that swung from blue to red in 2016. If a surprise development rocked Biden's chances before Nov. 3, Trump would become the new projected favorite in Florida with a lead just under 2 percentage points. According to simulations by election forecasting company, <a href=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president\">Decision Desk HQ</a>, Trump wins a second term only 10% of the time without landing Florida.&#160;</p><p>Any similar last minute developments would also diminish Biden's lead in Arizona and North Carolina, FiveThirtyEight projects. Both states went to Trump in 2016 for a combined 25 electoral votes. Neither Biden nor Trump are completely reliant on these states to win, but their electoral votes allow for an easier path to the White House.</p><p>As of Oct. 8, <a href=\"https://electproject.github.io/Early-Vote-2020G/index.html\">over 6 million people</a> have already cast their votes through mail-in and early voting in an election expected to receive the most mailed votes than any other in US history. At this point in 2016, about a month away from the election, <a href=\"http://www.electproject.org/early_2016\">only 75,000 mail-in votes</a> had been cast. According to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/america-likely-wont-know-presidential-race-winner-on-election-night-2020-5\">voting rights experts</a>, voting by mail is expected to make up 50% to 70% of the total vote in November.</p><p>It's impossible to predict if a highly scrutinized incident could occur right before the election and ruin Biden's chances.&#160;But, the closer a Comey-like event occurs to Election Day, the lower the likelihood of it upending the Biden campaign as a much greater proportion of votes will already be placed</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7de4c8282c500018c791c7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-32-710_d13e3f738626a970.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Tn3BPnp75IU:2zEvp1pqRu8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn43@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-31-159_bb048c289d500d08.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Tn3BPnp75IU:2zEvp1pqRu8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn25@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-34-475_3ee721086ccf8e76.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Tn3BPnp75IU:2zEvp1pqRu8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-31-543_2b83e95b195a878f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Tn3BPnp75IU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-28-768_d3c66835f041a036.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360898},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"How to block or unblock someone on the Signal secure-messaging app in just a few taps","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-block-someone-on-signal","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7b6e79282c500018c78ada?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Signal Messaging App\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to block and unblock users on Signal.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Picture Alliance/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can block someone from contacting you on Signal, and unblock users you've blocked, just like you can on most messaging apps.</li>\n<li>To block a user, open a conversation with them and tap their name at the top of the screen. The option to block them is at the bottom of the profile page.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>If you use <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/signal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Signal</a>, a messaging app that boasts <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/end-to-end-encryption\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">end-to-end encryption</a> for highly secure text, voice, and video communication, you might occasionally need to block unwanted Signal users from contacting you. You can do this in just a few taps.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to block someone on Signal</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the Signal app on your mobile device.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> From your inbox, open a conversation with the person you want to block.</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Tap the name of the person at the very top of the screen to open their user profile page.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7b6b2c94fce90018f7b2c9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_block_someone_on_Signal 1\" height=\"2688\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>After tapping a conversation, tap the person&#39;s name at the very top of the screen.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> Tap \"Block User\" at the bottom of the screen and then confirm you want to do this by tapping \"Block\" in the pop-up window.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7b6bbc94fce90018f7b2ce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_block_someone_on_Signal 2\" height=\"2298\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap &#34;Block User&#34; at the bottom of the screen to keep the person from contacting you.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5.</strong> Tap \"OK\" in the pop-up to confirm this user is now blocked.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to unblock someone on Signal</strong></h2><p>It's easy to tell when someone is blocked on Signal. For example, you'll see \"Blocked\" appear below the user's name in conversations in your inbox. If you want to unblock this person, you can easily do so. Just tap a conversation with the user and then tap \"Unblock\" at the bottom of the screen.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7b6c44282c500018c78acf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_block_someone_on_Signal 3\" height=\"2688\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>After blocking someone, the option to unblock them appears prominently in saved conversations.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You can also tap the name of the person at the top of the screen and tap \"Unblock User\" on their user profile page.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-create-a-signal-chat\">How to create a Signal chat to talk with individuals or groups on the secure messaging platform</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-someone-to-a-signal-chat\">How to add someone to a Signal group chat or remove users</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-change-phone-number-on-signal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to change your phone number on the Signal messaging app on an iPhone or Android device<br></a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-lock-signal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to lock your Signal messaging app with a passcode and keep all of your private conversations and files secure</a></h3></li><li><h3><a 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Moderator Susan Page on Pence interrupting her during VP debate: 'I don't know that I've seen him in that kind of setting with a male moderator'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/susan-page-on-pence-interrupting-her-during-vp-debate-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e753cc655f6001969ed5e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1279067000\" height=\"1342\" width=\"2685\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Senator Kamala Harris of California and Vice President Mike Pence.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Susan Page, who moderated Wednesday's debate, reflected on Vice President Mike Pence continually interrupting her as she attempted to ask the candidates questions.</li>\n<li>When asked about the interruptions in a YouTube video by USA Today on Thursday, Page, who heads USA Today's Washington bureau, pointed out the vice president behaved similarly in the last vice presidential debate in 2016.</li>\n<li>\"Of course, he participated in the vice presidential debate four years ago with a woman moderator, and he did similar things with that debate as well where he talked on and talked over her,\" Page said during the video.</li>\n<li>\"I don't know that I've seen him in that kind of setting with a male moderator,\" she continued.</li>\n<li>A post-debate analysis by CBS News found that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pence-interrupted-harris-twice-as-often-during-debate-cbs-finds-2020-10\">Pence interrupted Harris</a> twice as often as she did to him during the debate. Pence interrupted Harris 10 times, while she interrupted him five times.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>USA Today's Susan Page reflected on moderating Wednesday's debate between Vice President Mike Pence and Sen. Kamala Harris and being interrupted by the vice president.</p><p>Spectators watching noticed Pence continually interrupting Page during the debate, and the moderator constantly reiterating, \"Thank you, Mr. Vice President,\" to rein in his responses.</p><p>When asked about the interruptions in a <a href=\"https://youtube.com/watch?v=GCOes8dJfqs&ab_channel=USATODAYODAY\">YouTube video by USA Today</a> on Thursday, Page said she didn't \"know the answer to that,\" but noted the vice president behaved similarly in the last vice presidential debate in 2016.</p><p>\"Of course, he participated in the vice presidential debate four years ago with a woman moderator, and he did similar things with that debate as well where he talked on and talked over her,\" Page said during the video. \"I don't know that I've seen him in that kind of setting with a male moderator.\"</p><p>Page, who heads USA Today's Washington bureau, pointed out that both candidates had light indicators to signal when they ran out of time to talk, during which she would interject their responses to stop them from speaking.</p><p>Page faced criticism Wednesday night, with some saying that she had failed to keep Harris and Pence within their allotted speaking times. During a particularly heated moment in the debate when the vice president asked for more time, Page shut him down.</p><p>\"Your campaigns agreed to the rules for tonight's debate with the Commission of Presidential Debates,\" she responded on Wednesday. \"I'm here to enforce them, which involves moving from one topic to another, giving roughly equal time to both of you, which I'm trying hard to do.\"</p><p>A post-debate analysis by CBS News found that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pence-interrupted-harris-twice-as-often-during-debate-cbs-finds-2020-10\">Pence interrupted Harris</a> twice as often as she did to him during the debate. Pence interrupted Harris 10 times, whereas she interrupted him five times.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 02:54:37 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7e5d50c655f6001969ed4e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"7c543f22faebddcf13c5c4218568008d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn79@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-23-126_abd2725309700305.webp","destWidth":1333,"destHeight":1000,"sourceBytes":45156,"destBytes":45156,"author":"insider@insider.com (Lauren Frias)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7e753cc655f6001969ed5e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn46@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-30-289_6e635c2330a5ea78.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TmVh99-JHXY:GfMAS-6Uaxc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn73@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-25-892_0c2fe3ef675b8546.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TmVh99-JHXY:GfMAS-6Uaxc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn71@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-30-697_7cb7f598c8db99ad.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TmVh99-JHXY:GfMAS-6Uaxc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-24-896_560da8d275d30c4e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/TmVh99-JHXY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-32-910_d845d1d7c4a28fd6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360909},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"How to delete your Netflix viewing history, and prevent something you've watched from affecting your viewing recommendations","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-delete-netflix-history","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf01aaa11e2054a52234aad?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: The Netflix logo is shown in this illustration photograph in Encinitas, California October 14, 2014.   REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo\" height=\"2119\" width=\"2825\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>If you don&#39;t want something you&#39;ve watched on Netflix to affect your recommendations, you can remove it from your viewing history.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>You can delete your Netflix history one title at a time, but you can't erase your entire history at once.</strong></li><li><strong>Deleting your Netflix history will stop those movies and shows from appearing in your \"Continue Watching\" section, as well as alter what Netflix recommends you in the future.</strong></li><li><strong>To delete your Netflix history, you'll need to use the Netflix website on a computer.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><p>Most of the time, this is a good thing — because <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/netflix\">Netflix</a> knows exactly what you are watching, it can place shows in progress in the \"Continue Watching\" section so you can easily pick up where you left off. It also can use shows you have watched to make better recommendations about what you might want to see in the future.</p><p>But if you don't want <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/netflix\">Netflix</a> to use your viewing history, you have a little control. You can remove individual movies and TV shows from your history. This can keep Netflix from making viewing recommendations and is a sort of \"nuclear option\" for keeping other people on your account from seeing what you're watching.</p><p>But since you can't delete your entire viewing history at once, this can be time-consuming if you want to delete a lot of items.</p><h2><strong>How to delete your Netflix viewing history</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>In a web browser, go to the Netflix website. You can do this on a computer or in a browser on a mobile device, but you can't use the Netflix mobile app.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Click your account icon at the top right of the browser window, and then click \"Account.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf0192c11e20549fb5a8a77?format=jpeg\" alt=\"history 1\" height=\"1875\" width=\"1871\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>To delete items from your viewing history, go to your Account page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3. </strong>Scroll down to the section called My Profile and click \"Viewing Activity.\"</p><p><strong>4. </strong>On the My Activity page, you'll see a list of the most recent Netflix movies and TV shows you have watched. To see more, scroll to the bottom and click \"Show More.\"</p><p><strong>5. </strong>To remove a video from your viewing history, click the \"stop\" icon to the right of \"Report a Problem.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf0194211e2054a311b1ea3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"history 2\" height=\"1876\" width=\"1871\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Click the &#34;stop&#34; icon to remove a movie or show from your history.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6. </strong>Repeat that process for any other movies or shows you want to remove.</p><p>Anything you delete will be removed from your viewing history within 24 hours.</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-download-movies-from-netflix\">How to download Netflix movies and shows onto your phone or tablet to watch when you're without internet</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-cancel-netflix\">How to cancel your Netflix subscription, however you subscribed to it</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-log-out-of-netflix-on-roku\">How to log out of your Netflix account on any Roku device</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-much-is-netflix\">'How much does Netflix cost?': All of Netflix's subscription plans, explained</a></h3></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"The best cat fountains","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-cat-fountain","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Cats like to drink fresh running water, so a cat fountain is a great way to encourage them to stay hydrated. </strong></li><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000L3XYZ4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B000L3XYZ4&linkId=a061b592cfdc9fcb84da67193fdeb193cfdc9fcb84da67193fdeb193\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain</a>&#160;is the best one you can buy with its free-falling stream, generous basin, integrated filtration system, and adjustable flow control for maximum freshness.</strong></li></ul><p>Does your cat hop up onto the counter every time you turn on the faucet? Do they drink from the toilet or dip their paws into the water bowl before drinking? These behaviors may seem strange, but they actually have a logical reason — cats don't like drinking still or stagnant water. They also tend to have a low thirst drive in general.</p><p>Water is an essential nutrient for cats, however, so it is important to ensure that your cat stays properly hydrated. One of the best ways to increase your cat's water intake is to provide him with a cat fountain.</p><p>A cat fountain is designed to give your cat unlimited access to fresh water. These fountains come in many different forms, so you can choose the model that best suits your cat's preferences. Some fountains consist simply of a trough that refills as your cat drinks while others produce a free-falling water supply for maximum freshness.&#160;</p><h2>Here are the best cat fountains:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell 360 Pet Fountain</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>Updated on 10/8/20. We updated prices, links, and formatting.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best cat fountain overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5925ad1c6391472d558b5b94?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pet fountain best\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">PetSafe</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000L3XYZ4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000L3XYZ4&#38;linkId=a061b592cfdc9fcb84da67193fdeb193\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain</a> is our top pick for cat fountains with its a free-falling stream, generous basin, integrated filtration system, and adjustable flow.</h3><p>The perfect cat fountain should keep your cat's water supply fresh and clean while encouraging them to drink more water. It should also be affordable, durably constructed, and easy to clean. The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000L3XYZ4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000L3XYZ4&#38;linkId=a061b592cfdc9fcb84da67193fdeb193\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain</a>&#160;checks all the boxes.</p><p>This unit is an updated version of the Drinkwell Original, and it features improved pump and motor performance, as well as reduced noise and increased water circulation.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000L3XYZ4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000L3XYZ4&#38;linkId=a061b592cfdc9fcb84da67193fdeb193\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain</a> mimics the effects of a running faucet with its free-falling stream design. An integrated filtration system featuring an activated carbon filter keeps your cat's water supply fresh, clean, and free from odors to entice them into drinking more water. Made from BPA-free plastic, not only is the design of this fountain functional, but it is aesthetically pleasing and it runs quietly.</p><p>The quality construction of this fountain makes it durable and reliable. The submersible motor and pre-filter save you from the frustration of clogging by removing dirt and hair from the water column. However, the internal parts and filters do require frequent changing.</p><p>This fountain also offers several options for adjustability to suit your cat's individual preferences.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Appealing but simple design, free-falling stream, generous 168-ounce water basin, adjustable flow control, submersible pump and pre-filter system, low-voltage 12V system, made from BPA-free plastic</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Filter needs frequent changing, internal parts can be challenging to clean, some assembly required for use and cleaning&#160;</p>\n\tThe best ceramic cat fountain\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5925adad6391471f008b6252?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ceramic pet fountain\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">PetSafe</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With dual free-flowing streams, the ceramic <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00HQHFDCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00HQHFDCU&#38;linkId=1d7d8588620bed1cfe949bb555ea418b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Pagoda Fountain</a> keeps your cat's water fresh while inhibiting the growth of bacteria.&#160;</h3><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00HQHFDCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00HQHFDCU&#38;linkId=1d7d8588620bed1cfe949bb555ea418b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Pagoda Fountain</a> features a hygienic ceramic construction with a modern design that is sure to fit with your home decor. With dual free-flowing streams, up to 70 ounces of water is kept oxygenated through constant motion. The integrated filtration system includes a pump with a replaceable carbon filter that removes bad tastes and odors, keeping your cat's water fresh and clean.</p><p>Although the ceramic construction of the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00HQHFDCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00HQHFDCU&#38;linkId=1d7d8588620bed1cfe949bb555ea418b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell Pagoda Fountain</a> makes it a little more fragile than some models, it is top-shelf dishwasher safe for easy cleaning. Plus, the ceramic surface won't scratch or harbor bacteria the way that plastic fountains sometimes can. The streamlined design is also aesthetically pleasing and will fit with your home decor.</p><p>Just keep in mind that this fountain is more fragile than plastic or stainless steel models and the carbon filter may need to be replaced frequently for optimal performance.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Dual free-flow streams keep water fresh, hygienic and streamlined ceramic design, 70-ounce water capacity for multiple pets, two drinking areas, top-shelf dishwasher safe, integrated filtration system with replaceable carbon filters</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Ceramic materials are fragile, may become noisy as water is depleted, pump and housing parts are made of plastic, may stain if you use tap water versus filtered water, filter needs to be changed often</p>\n\tThe best stainless steel cat fountain\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5925ae976391471b008b62eb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pioneer Steel cat fountain\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pioneer Pet/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With its elegant design and streamlined performance, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0037NKDSG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0037NKDSG&#38;linkId=6883a8e472af30be4fb17fe56c58c414\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">Pioneer Pet Raindrop fountain</a> is a versatile and reliable cat fountain.</h3><p>Since water movement encourages cats to drink more, the <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2rA6Lyv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Pioneer Pet Raindrop</a> is designed exactly for that purpose. This pet fountain features a 60-ounce stainless-steel basin with a unique slide design that maximizes water circulation and bubbling while minimizing noise and splash. You'll also love the aesthetic appeal of this pet fountain. It will go with any style of home decor.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0037NKDSG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0037NKDSG&#38;linkId=6883a8e472af30be4fb17fe56c58c414\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">Pioneer Pet Raindrop Fountain</a> comes with a premium replaceable charcoal filter to keep your cat's water pure, clean, and free from hair and debris. The pump and filter are enclosed in a plastic housing under the unit for safety and the seven-foot cord detaches for convenience and cleaning. Simply disassemble the unit and place the stainless-steel parts in the dishwasher.</p><p>Stainless-steel pet fountains offer excellent durability, easy cleaning, and aesthetic appeal &#8212; these are all qualities that the <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2rA6Lyv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Pioneer Pet Raindrop</a> has in spades. Affordably priced and protected by a one-year warranty, this pet fountain is sure to please.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Durable and hygienic stainless steel construction, attractive design, generous 60-ounce basin, slide to promote circulation and minimize splash, dishwasher safe, replaceable charcoal filter, comes with a one-year warranty, detachable 7-foot cord for easy cleaning</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Filter needs to be replaced regularly, requires some disassembly for cleaning, may become noisy as water is depleted, may not be large enough for multi-cat households, pump may burn out with constant use <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2rA6Lyv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"></a></p>\n\tThe best gravity-run cat fountain\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5925afe363914743008b62db?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gravity cat fountain\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">PetSafe</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>For a simple but practical cat water fountain that keeps your cat's water fresh without any expensive bells and whistles, we recommend the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002RT8M84/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002RT8M84&#38;linkId=f6aabf424fcd2e509c3c799312efe36b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Healthy Pet Water Station</a>.</h3><p>If you want to keep your cat's water fresh and clean but you don't want to pay for a high-end model, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002RT8M84/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002RT8M84&#38;linkId=f6aabf424fcd2e509c3c799312efe36b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Healthy Pet Water Station</a> offers the ideal combination of affordability and performance. Constructed from BPA-free plastic with a stainless-steel bowl, this gravity-run cat fountain is simple to use and easy to clean. You can also purchase an optional Healthy Pet Water Filter which will remove odors and sediment for maximum freshness and odor control.</p><p>Available in three sizes, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002RT8M84/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002RT8M84&#38;linkId=f6aabf424fcd2e509c3c799312efe36b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Healthy Pet Water Station</a> features a durable reservoir made from BPA-free plastic that locks into place and includes a flow-control system to prevent spills.&#160;</p><p>This fountain is simple but functional. It may not have all the bells and whistles you'll get with premium models, but it is simple to use and easy to refill without spilling water everywhere. It is also a very durable design, so it won't break easily if you drop it or your cat knocks it over.</p><p>Loved for its practical, low-spill design and gravity-run performance, this fountain is also very affordable.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Simple gravity-run design, reservoir made from BPA-free plastic, removable stainless steel bowl, easy to clean without any small parts, flow-control system to prevent spills, comes in three sizes up to 1 gallon, dishwasher-safe for easy cleaning, reservoir locks into the base</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Doesn't have a free-flowing stream or bubbler, smallest size may be too small for adult cats, filter must be purchased separately, water flow control may get stuck sometimes<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2WizDZ2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"></a></p>\n\tThe best multi-pet cat fountain\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5925b069639147711a8b57bb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"multi pet fountain\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">PetSafe</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With five flow rings and adjustable flow control, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002SB91QS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002SB91QS&#38;linkId=5b100d9fabb55c6d62262dd0a88e3793\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell 360 Pet Fountain</a> enables you to customize the fountain to suit your cat's preferences, and it's big enough for multiple pets.</h3><p>If you live in a multi-cat household and you have trouble keeping your water bowls filled, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002SB91QS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002SB91QS&#38;linkId=5b100d9fabb55c6d62262dd0a88e3793\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell 360 Pet Fountain</a> may be just what you've been looking for. With a large 128-ounce capacity and up to 5 adjustable streams, this fountain is the ideal solution.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002SB91QS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_052417_best-cat-fountains-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002SB91QS&#38;linkId=5b100d9fabb55c6d62262dd0a88e3793\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">PetSafe Drinkwell 360 Pet Fountain</a> features a two-stage filter design to keep your cat's water fresh, clean, and free from odors. Plus, with adjustable flow control and five flow rings, you can choose how many streams the fountain produces and at what rate they flow. The unique design allows your cat to drink from the basin or directly from the stream, according to their preference.</p><p>The fountain does require some disassembly for cleaning and it may also splash outside the basin if overfilled. This unit is a little pricier than some, but it offers unmatched benefits for versatility and customizability.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Durable and hygienic stainless steel construction, large 128-ounce capacity, up to 5 changeable streams, included replaceable carbon filter, adjustable flow control, 360-degree design for multi-cat households, top-shelf dishwasher safe, easy to assemble and use</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Some disassembly required for cleaning, carbon filter needs to be replaced often, regular cleaning needed to prevent clogs, may splash if overfilled<a href=\"http://amzn.to/2qWG6Ji\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"></a></p>\n\tCheck out our other great cat guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Y1JM3FHIRYc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 08 Oct (Kate Barrington)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5925ad1c6391472d558b5b94?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn71@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-34-103_5ddf35242f2b737b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5925adad6391471f008b6252?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5925ae976391471b008b62eb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn34@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-33-176_c5675ea937dc756a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5925afe363914743008b62db?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn33@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-32-465_149c26d997f540ed.webp","https://i.insider.com/5925b069639147711a8b57bb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn11@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-25-550_33d357dd40fab3e3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db1ef1cdee0196a9b75bab4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn18@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-33-796_9f8add0212c4c19f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Y1JM3FHIRYc:4KfvM71P2-8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn53@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-32-490_56e48d3050dc467a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Y1JM3FHIRYc:4KfvM71P2-8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn60@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-33-909_014f32ab93970e6f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Y1JM3FHIRYc:4KfvM71P2-8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn63@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-31-991_be45ce45ede1c152.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Y1JM3FHIRYc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn12@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-31-549_672bc4f4a72f26fb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360916},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"After a thwarted plot to kidnap the governor, Michigan's attorney general tells Business Insider the far right is trying to 'disrupt' Michigan ahead of the election","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-attorney-general-far-right-aims-to-disrupt-the-state-2020-10","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7fbcbf4c3b2e0019bba097?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1146130585\" height=\"1674\" width=\"2232\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Attorney Dana Nessel, surrounded by her family, announces her bid for Michigan Attorney General in Braun Court Ann Arbor on Tuesday, Aug. 15, 2017. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Mandi Wright/Detroit Free Press/Tribune News Service via Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel spoke to Business Insider about an alleged far-right plot to kidnap Gov. Gretchen Whitmer and hold a mock trial for \"treason.\"</li> \n <li>Nessel said it is no longer safe to dismiss far-right paramilitary groups as a laughing matter.</li> \n <li>\"Once you've moved from just a bunch of guys blowing off steam to training exercises across multiple jurisdictions, and really heavily investing time, energy and effort… now we have to take it very seriously,\" she said.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>Far-right activists and paramilitary groups, emboldened by the rhetoric — and sometimes support — from state and federal leaders, are trying to sow chaos in the state of Michigan ahead of the 2020 election, state Attorney General Dana Nessel said in an interview with Business Insider.</p>\n<p>\"They see Michigan as a place where, if they cause enough disruptions, they can win again,\" Nessel, a Democrat, said Thursday, referring to US President Donald Trump's razor-thin victory in 2016.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Nessel's remarks came hours after she <a href=\"https://www.michigan.gov/ag/0,4534,7-359-92297_99936-541891--,00.html\">announced anti-terrorism charges</a> against seven men accused of participating in a conspiracy to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-militia-kidnapping-wearing-wire-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">kidnap Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer</a>, a frequent target of the president's ire, and hold a mock trial for \"treason\" over her state's COVID-19 lockdown. The men are accused of participating in or being associates of a paramilitary organization, the Wolverine Watchmen, that is associated with the far-right Boogaloo movement, whose members have <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-06-17/far-right-boogaloo-boys-linked-to-killing-of-california-lawmen-other-violence\">assassinated cops</a> as part of an effort to spur a civil war.</p>\n<p>US Attorney Andrew Birge, a Trump appointee, also charged six individuals as part of a joint state-federal investigation into the plot. According to the federal complaint, the men — at least one of whom tweeted support for President Trump — planned to kidnap Whitmer at her vacation home or official governor's summer residence.</p>\n<p>\"Snatch and grab, man,\" said one of the alleged conspirators, who reportedly engaged in firearms training and tactical drills in what the <a href=\"https://apps.npr.org/documents/document.html?id=7223362-Michigan-Kidnapping-Conspiracy\">federal complaint</a> describes as a \"remote area of Michigan.\"</p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">\n —Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) \n <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1251169217531056130?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 17, 2020</a>\n</blockquote>\n<script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script>\n<p>Nessel was once inclined to dismiss such rhetoric as the overheated musings of cosplay-soldiers. \"But you know, this is much scarier than that,\" she said.</p>\n<p>\"These are individuals who seemingly are very committed to the cause. This went from what seemed to be hostile and angry rhetoric to planning,\" she said. \"Plans to be disruptive to government; to kill law enforcement officials; to potentially blow up the Capitol building; and, of course, to kidnap and put on trial and execute the governor.\"</p>\n<p>\"Once you've moved from just a bunch of guys blowing off steam to training exercises across multiple jurisdictions, and really heavily investing time, energy and effort… now we have to take it very seriously,\" she added.</p>\n<p>Facebook, where the alleged conspirators were caught discussing retribution against Gov. Whitmer, has taken steps in recent months to prohibit paramilitary groups from organizing on its platform. But it is still widely used by far-right activists to organize.</p>\n<p>\"I definitely think it's increasing their numbers,\" Nessel said, \"and it's never good when you have a social media platform used that way.\"</p>\n<p>Still, Facebook is far from the only, or even the most important, factor.</p>\n<p>In April 2020, President Trump, defying the advice of public health experts, egged on opponents of Gov. Whitmer's stay-at-home order, designed to slow the spread of the coronavirus. \"LIBERATE MICHIGAN!\" he tweeted.</p>\n<p>Weeks later, after armed protesters entered Michigan's state capitol building, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-protestors-with-guns-in-michigan-capitol-are-very-good-people-2020-5\">Trump tweeted approvingly</a>. \"These are very good people, but they are angry,\" he said. \"See them, talk to them, make a deal.\"</p>\n<p>According to Nessel, several of the armed men who attended that protest were later involved in the plot to kidnap Whitmer. Indeed, they used that protest to recruit, she said.</p>\n<p>\"These guys think that he's talking to them,\" Nessel said. \"He actually said, you recall, that the governor ought to sit down and negotiate with these armed gunmen. That provides that cover, you know — that legitimacy. That's all they need sometimes to escalate their operations, because they feel like they have the support of the president himself.\"</p>\n<p>That appears to have been the case with two other far-right activists who were <a href=\"https://www.michigan.gov/ag/0,4534,7-359--541876--,00.html\">arraigned on Thursday</a>: Jacob Wohl, a 22-year-old social media provocateur before he was banned from Twitter, and 54-year-old Jack Burkman. The two are accused of trying to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-right-wing-activist-jacob-wohl-accused-of-voter-intimidation-2020-10\">intimidate Michigan voters</a>, allegedly using robocalls to spread false information about mail-in ballots in order to depress turnout.</p>\n<p>Nessel thinks the fact that such people have Michigan in their crosshairs has a lot to do with 2016 and \"the fact that Trump won our state,\" which until then was generally considered a reliable Democratic stronghold; he won by less than 11,000 votes.</p>\n<p>\"In 2016, a large part of the reason why Trump won here is because of these voter-suppression tactics, in large part that stemmed from misinformation being disseminated,\" Nessel said. It would appear some supporter think it's worth another shot, she said. \"It worked last time.\"</p>\n<p><em>Have a news tip? Email this reporter: <a href=\"mailto:cdavis@insider.com\">cdavis@insider.com</a></em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-attorney-general-far-right-aims-to-disrupt-the-state-2020-10\">Business Insider</a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"feedflare\"> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n</div>\n<img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/2pHSr2L1y84\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 09 Oct 2020 02:17:59 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7fbcbf4c3b2e0019bba097?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3fe30f18a57ad9778f64836ad4ebc71c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-32-41-256_94ab07b6e7cc274b.webp","destWidth":2232,"destHeight":1674,"sourceBytes":81670,"destBytes":81670,"author":"cdavis@insider.com (Charles Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7fbcbf4c3b2e0019bba097?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-32-41-256_94ab07b6e7cc274b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn60@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-34-687_897c5db3fceed5df.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn16@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-27-158_6b2b639dfd068fb3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2pHSr2L1y84:Y3Y2NNsjS-Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn43@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-27-543_82046263764c96b4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/2pHSr2L1y84":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn5@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-28-687_c96cd1f7f3aea195.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360890},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"'It was an honor': US Army soldier, one of the first women to earn Ranger tab, on leading Ruth Bader Ginsburg's lying in state ceremony","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/first-woman-ranger-on-ruth-bader-ginsburg-funeral-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f778694282c500018c7863f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"shaye haver\" height=\"821\" width=\"1643\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US Army Capt. Shaye Haver, a company commander of 1st Battalion, 3rd Infantry Regiment.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Army</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>One of the first women to complete the US Army's Ranger School had the distinct honor of leading Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's lying in state procession at the US Capitol.</li>\n<li>\"I am a huge fan of really strong leaders, and I think that Justice Ginsburg was able to champion a lot of things,\" US Army Capt. Shaye Haver, a company commander of 1st Battalion, 3rd Infantry Regiment, told Insider.</li>\n<li>Ginsburg's lying in state was Haver's first official procession.</li>\n<li>The parallels between Ginsburg and Haver's career accomplishments were not lost on observers.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>One of the first women to complete the US Army's Ranger School had the distinct honor of leading Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's lying in state procession at the US Capitol in late September, a ceremony the soldier described as humbling because of its significance.</p><p>\"I am a huge fan of really strong leaders, and I think that Justice Ginsburg was able to champion a lot of things,\" US Army Capt. Shaye Haver, a company commander of 1st Battalion, 3rd Infantry Regiment, told Insider. \"I think that anybody can be proud of and inspired by that. It was an honor to be part of such a large-scale operation to honor a person like that.\"</p><p>Gisburg died at 87 after battling pancreatic cancer and is interred next to her husband's grave at Arlington National Cemetery. Prior to that, she was given the honor of being carried by a joint casket team, also known as body bearers, represented by all the long-standing military services: two service members from the Army, Marines, and Navy; and one from the Air Force and Coast Guard.</p><p>Because the Army is the largest branch in the military, it also provides the officer-in-charge of the procession, who is traditionally selected from one of the four companies within the Army's ceremonial unit, also known as \"The Old Guard.\" Each of these company commanders are responsible for different sequences of the procession.</p><p>D-Company, also known as \"Doghouse Company,\" is responsible for the Capitol sequence, in which the casket team receives the remains from the hearse and carries it up the Capitol Rotunda. D-Company's previous commander led the Capitol sequence for Democratic Rep. John Lewis, who died in July.</p><p>The responsibility of the Capitol sequence for Ginsburg's lying in state rested on the shoulders of Capt. Haver, who first took command of the company in August.</p><p>Ginsburg's lying in state was Haver's first official procession.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7e0c99282c500018c792ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tomb of the unknown soldier\" height=\"2001\" width=\"4003\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A soldier from the Old Guard at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery May 6, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reese Brown/Fort Belvoir Community Hospital</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>While her duties in the ceremony were happenstance due to her position, Haver volunteered to become a member of the iconic Old Guard.</p><p>\"A lot of people don't know that we do funerals in Arlington National Cemetery every single day,\" Haver&#160;told Insider. \"And that's for veterans, fallen heroes, and for their spouses and dependents as well.\"</p><p>\"Knowing that about this unit, and knowing the level of precision that is required to give excellent honors to those members, is something that I knew that I wanted to be a part of — something that I always strive for personally to ensure that I am giving my best effort at absolutely everything that I do,\" she added.</p><p>The highly competitive process to become a member of the Old Guard is reflected through their physical requirements, including hoisting a casket and carrying it up the 35 steps of the Capitol Rotunda.</p><p>\"The most difficult part of the transfer of remains is carrying the casket up the steps,\" Haver&#160;said. \"It's our biggest risk in the mission, to getting that right.\"</p><p>Service members are not allowed to look down while walking up and down the steps, and to remain \"in our ceremonial composure,\" Haver said.</p><p>\"I was literally looking straight down the road in front of me, walking down those ... and knowing that we're about the step down on the next level of stairs,\" Haver&#160;added.</p><p>While their expectations are high, the Old Guard does not get much opportunity to rehearse with service members from the other branches for a state ceremony. Other than one exercise a year, the body bearers of a joint casket team do not work together until being notified.</p><p>\"It just highlights how professional and how capable this team is — to be able to be rapidly notified like that — come together and execute such a flawless ceremony,\" Haver said.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7d6ec0282c500018c79071?format=jpeg\" alt=\"capt havers\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2499\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Capt. Shaye Haver and Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Army and Nikki Kahn/The Washington Post via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The parallels between Ginsburg and Haver's career accomplishments were not lost on observers of the lying in state procession in Washington, D.C.</p><p>Ginsburg became a liberal, feminist champion while serving on the Supreme Court for 27 years. During her tenure, Ginsburg led battles in courtrooms to gender equality — even taking up cases involving sex discrimination against men. She also penned the 7-1 majority opinion against Virginia Military Institute's admission process that barred women from its ranks, arguing \"how much good women could do for the institution.\"</p><p>Ginsburg is the first woman to lie in state at the US Capitol.</p><p>Haver became one of the first women to complete the Army's strenuous <a href=\"https://www.goarmy.com/soldier-life/being-a-soldier/ongoing-training/specialized-schools/ranger-school.html\">Ranger School</a>, which is designed to prepare soldiers for combat patrol operations in difficult terrain. Roughly half of its volunteer-candidates fail the 62-day course.</p><p>Women were allowed to volunteer for Ranger School in 2015, upending the decades-long tradition of the all-male fighting force.</p><p>\"When we're willing and we do the same things with them every day, that's what they want to see,\" Haver told the <a href=\"https://www.armytimes.com/news/your-army/2018/03/13/first-female-ranger-grads-open-up-about-the-aftermath-and-joining-the-infantry/\">Army Times</a> in 2018.</p><p>Haver said she understood the significance of her role during Ginsburg's procession, but suspended those thoughts until after the event.</p><p>\"For this specifically, in order to ... serve my team best, I kind of had to internalize the mission and maybe reflect a little bit afterwards of what it meant to me personally,\" Haver said. \"But honestly, being a part of the joint team and being able to perform on that day was an amazing experience for me to learn.\"</p><p>\"We know that the service was conducted in a way that Justice Ginsburg herself would have been honored to have received,\" Haver added.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/first-woman-ranger-on-ruth-bader-ginsburg-funeral-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div
