(David Choi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f778694282c500018c7863f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-34-607_f03aacb7b264806f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7e0c99282c500018c792ef?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn53@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-33-318_01e10c4313ebaef4.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7d6ec0282c500018c79071?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn52@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-33-756_9d12da46b36c97ca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AjChOqV1Mpg:p59pcQ1Adcw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn4@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-31-566_8aa91f260ef95373.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AjChOqV1Mpg:p59pcQ1Adcw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn17@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-27-994_c63aacb63de92014.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AjChOqV1Mpg:p59pcQ1Adcw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-31-456_24d09ab2ecb7b4af.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/AjChOqV1Mpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn11@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-27-040_253fb7b605d4e150.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360907},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Armed Michigan plotters hid their cellphones in a box to be safe but failed to check each other for wires","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-militia-kidnapping-wearing-wire-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f5493c655f6001969f03e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gretchen Whitmer\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/David Eggert</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Members of the armed group, who were charged with plotting to kidnap Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, made some security lapses during their group meetings.</li>\n<li>One of the members collected all of their cell phones and put them in a box \"to prevent any monitoring,\" a federal affidavit said.</li>\n<li>Unbeknownst to them, however, one of the confidential sources who attended the meeting was wearing a recording device.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Several members of an armed group who were charged with plotting to kidnap Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan at her vacation home failed to thoroughly inspect each other for security breaches during a group meeting, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-foiled-right-wing-militia-plot-kidnap-michigan-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">according to a federal affidavit</a> released Thursday.</p><p>Adam Fox, one of the six men who was charged in the plot, was said to have met with other accomplices at his business in Grand Rapids on June 20. According to federal investigators, Fox was aware of the risks and conducted the meeting in the basement that was \"accessed through a trap door hidden under a rug.\"</p><p>Fox then collected all of the cell phones in a box and put it upstairs \"to prevent any monitoring,\" the criminal complaint said.</p><p>Unbeknownst to Fox, however, one of the confidential sources who attended the meeting was wearing a recording device. The audio revealed that the group had plans to attack the state capitol and use Molotov cocktails against police vehicles.</p><p>All of the FBI's confidential sources were vetted for reliability and none of them \"were aware of the [others] involved with the groups in order to preserve the independence of their reporting.\"</p><p>While the affidavit only relied on two confidential sources and two undercover employees, it used other sources during the investigation.</p><p>Six men were charged in connection with the kidnapping plot. The FBI said it became aware of the plans sometime in early 2020 through social media channels. Seven other men were charged with terrorism-related crimes.</p><p>\"Several members talked about murdering 'tyrants' or 'taking' a sitting governor,\" FBI agent Richard Trask II said in the affidavit. \"The group decided they needed to increase their numbers and encouraged each other to talk to their neighbors and spread their message.\"</p><p>Fox also claimed he needed 200 men to attack the capitol building in Lansing and take hostages, including Gov. Whitmer.</p><p>\"Snatch and grab, man. Grab the f---in' governor. Just grab the b----,\" Fox said during a July 27 meeting. \"Because at that point, we do that, dude — it's over.\"</p><p>Whitmer has been criticized by conservative activists for the state's response to the coronavirus. In April, Whitmer extended a stay-at-home order that imposed restrictions on businesses that were classified as essential. The order was later rescinded as part of the state's reopening plans.</p><p>During a press conference on Thursday afternoon, Whitmer described the men as \"sick and depraved.\"</p><p>\"Hatred, bigotry and violence have no place in the great state of Michigan,\" she said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 19:49:54 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7f54b3282c500018c796d0?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"177e7a7cf9d048af937df4f49e99eb79","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn91@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-23-155_2d0cfbec06810077.webp","destWidth":2133,"destHeight":1600,"sourceBytes":107570,"destBytes":107570,"author":"dchoi@businessinsider.com 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Square buys 4,709 bitcoins for $50 million on the potential it will be a 'ubiquitous currency'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-price-square-buys-million-ubiquitious-potential-currency-digital-tech-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f60abd5f23d00195951b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jack dorsey twitter\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jack Dorsey, Twitter CEO, and Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook COO, off camera, testify during a Senate (Select) Intelligence Committee hearing in Dirksen Building where they testified on the influence of foreign operations on social media on September 5, 2018\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tom Williams/CQ Roll Call</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Square said on Wednesday it purchased 4,709 bitcoins at an aggregate purchase price of $50 million.</strong></li><li><strong>The digital payments company said the investment represents approximately 1% of Square's total assets at the end of the second quarter of 2020.</strong></li><li><strong>Square sees potential for bitcoin to become \"a more ubiquitous currency\" in the future, the company said.</strong></li><li><strong>The direct investment into bitcoin builds upon its previous investments in the crypto industry.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestedium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/sq-stock\">Square</a> jumped as much as 3% on Thursday after <a href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20201008005334/en/\">it announced</a> it had purchased 4,709 <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/btc-usd\">bitcoins</a> for an aggregate price of $50 million.</p><p>Square paid an average price of $10,617 for each bitcoin. The company <a href=\"https://images.ctfassets.net/2d5q1td6cyxq/5sXNrlEh2mEnTvvhgtYOm2/737bcfdc15e2a1c3cbd9b9451710ce54/Square_Inc._Bitcoin_Investment_Whitepaper.pdf\">said it was able to</a> make the $50 million purchase within a day without disrupting the markets.</p><p>The firm said its investment in the digital currency represents approximately 1% of its total assets at the end of the second quarter of 2020.&#160;</p><p>Square's Chief Financial Officer Amrita Ahuja said that bitcoin \"has the potential to be a more ubiquitous currency in the future.\"</p><p>This isn't the first time Square got involved in bitcoin. In 2018, it launched the ability to buy and sell bitcoins within its Cash app, and in 2019, the company formed Square Crypto, a team solely focused on open-source work in the crypto space.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-packaged-food-companies-covid-cooking-stifel-2020-10?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Buy these 7 stocks poised to profit from the boom in packaged-food sales as COVID-19 prompts more Americans to cook at home, Stifel says</a></em></p><p>\"As it [bitcoin] grows in adoption, we intend to learn and participate in a disciplined way,\" Ahuja said.</p><p>Square said the investment aligns with its purpose of enabling everyone the ability to participate and thrive in the economy.&#160;</p><p>\"Square believes that cryptocurrency is an instrument of economic empowerment and provides a way for the world to participate in a global monetary system,\" the company said.&#160;</p><p>Bitcoin jumped as much as 3% in Thursday trades to $10,957.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f66258cd919001839da15?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sq.JPG\" height=\"637\" width=\"833\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/teS3T-oWcF8\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 08 Oct 2020 20:02:49 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f6cb8da0f4d550011032162?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"fe6ffc5739837f4030784391c19aeb4d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn11@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-22-707_6444996c9cf019c5.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1334,"sourceBytes":96024,"destBytes":96024,"author":"mfox@businessinsider.com (Matthew Fox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7f60abd5f23d00195951b4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn76@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-35-426_52e5e621f1393a9e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7f66258cd919001839da15?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=teS3T-oWcF8:YRkMdRimCd0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn9@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-809_229414df90a45699.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=teS3T-oWcF8:YRkMdRimCd0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn76@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-34-936_2699e714028839d3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=teS3T-oWcF8:YRkMdRimCd0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn13@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-29-597_d0430ba559a44274.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/teS3T-oWcF8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn1@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-29-911_b4cd8ea4f415cc9e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360894},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"A 100-year-old stock indicator just flashed a bullish signal suggesting further market upside","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/dow-theory-stock-market-bullish-outlook-signal-further-gains-transportation-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f3bdec655f6001969ef71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A trader works on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., March 4, 2020. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid\" height=\"2224\" width=\"4448\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>The Dow theory — a financial theory named after the father of technical analysis, Charles Dow — just flashed a bullish signal suggesting more upside ahead for the broader stock market.</strong></li><li><strong>The theory is based on the relative price action of the Dow Jones industrial average and the Dow Jones transportation average, as traders look for a move in one to be confirmed by a move in the other.</strong></li><li><strong>On Wednesday, the Dow Jones transportation average closed at a record high. The theory would suggest that the Dow Jones industrial average will soon follow.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Following the death of Charles Dow in 1902, hundreds of his editorials published in The Wall Street Journal (which he founded) were compiled and expanded on, giving rise to \"Dow theory.\"</p><p>Coined by S. A. Nelson and refined by William Hamilton and Robert Rhea, Dow theory is the study of the intermarket relationship between the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones\">Dow Jones industrial average</a> and the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow-jones-transportation\">Dow Jones rail average</a>, now called the transportation average.</p><p>The general idea is that both averages, over time, should move in tandem, given that the transportation average represents companies responsible for the movement of goods across the country. For that reason, it should serve as a leading indicator.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trading-strategy-legend-richard-dennis-shares-secrets-rules-to-millions-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Self-taught market wizard Richard Dennis took a $1600 loan and turned it into an estimated $200 million. He shares the 13 trading rules that turned his performance parabolic.</a></em></p><p>Put differently, both depend on each other: If the economy is thriving, transportation companies should also be thriving, as they are tasked with literally moving the economy.</p><p>Technical analysts look to Dow theory to confirm broad movements in the stock market. Specifically, traders look for confirmations and divergences between the two indexes.</p><p>A confirmation is when the transportation and industrial averages reach new highs (or lows), signaling that the trend in the broader market is up (or down). A divergence is when one of the two averages isn't moving in tandem with the other.</p><p>On Wednesday, the Dow Jones transportation average closed at a record high. The index has been driven by a surge in the parcel-delivery companies <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/fdx-stock\">FedEx</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/ups-stock\">UPS</a>, which have surged 205% and 114% from lows in mid-March.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-value-investing-strategy-from-fund-manager-david-herro-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">David Herro has steered the $22.2 billion Oakmark International fund through 5 crises since its inception 28 years ago. The veteran investor shares 3 stocks he's betting on, and the pandemic-related opportunities he's seizing.</a></em></p><p>Adding to the gains have been railroad companies, which have seen a steady uptick in demand during the COVID-19 pandemic.</p><p>Katie Farmer, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/brk-b-stock\">BNSF Railway's</a> incoming CEO, <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/25/incoming-ceo-of-warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-railroad-katie-farmer-on-the-economy.html\">told CNBC last month</a>: \"In the depth of the pandemic, our rail loadings were actually down to about 150,000 units a week. Now we have seen that continue to come back. And we anticipate this week we'll handle somewhere in the neighborhood of mid-195,000-to-196,000 range.\"</p><p>Meanwhile, the Dow Jones industrial average has not recently achieved a record high. Technical analysts will be looking for that average to follow the trend of the transportation average.</p><p>The index closed at a recent high of 29,100 on September 2, representing immediate upside potential of 3% (800 points) from Wednesday's close.</p><p>If the industrial average confirms the transportation average's record high, traders will look for the primary uptrend to continue in the stock market as the economy recovers from the COVID-19 pandemic.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-packaged-food-companies-covid-cooking-stifel-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Buy these 7 stocks poised to profit from the boom in packaged-food sales as COVID-19 prompts more Americans to cook at home, Stifel says</a></em></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4a2dc655f6001969effa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dow jones transports.JPG\" height=\"801\" width=\"1582\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">FreeStockCharts.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/dow-theory-stock-market-bullish-outlook-signal-further-gains-transportation-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a hours","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/mighty-patch-invisible-plus-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a height=\"1199\" width=\"1599\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hero Cosmetics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-originaloriginal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Mighty Patch</a>&#160;is the best overnight acne solution I've tried in a decade-long search.&#160;</li><li>It's a Hydrocolloid patch that acts as a magnet for the gunk inside a blemish, best worn overnight.</li><li>It also reduces exposure to germs, and is alcohol-, paraben-, and sulfate-free. Once the patch is removed, blemishes are drastically less severe.</li><li>The new <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Invisible+ Mighty Patch ($17.99, 39-count)</a> is an ultra-thin iteration designed so you can wear them during the daytime.&#160;</li><li>All in all, they are less conspicuous, but people will probably still notice if they're prominently featured. If you plan on wearing them out in public, though, they're worth buying.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\" aria-describedby=\"sk-tooltip-11026\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals</a>.</li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5e948cb329d6d96fac390994\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e948cb329d6d96fac390994&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>If you've dealt with acne before, somebody (or some company) has probably offered you the skincare equivalent of \"magic beans\" before: an affordable acne solution that zaps away blemishes overnight. That means that every cursed pimple that shows up right before a big interview, night out, first nerve-racking date, or big beach vacation could be dealt with before the damage could really make any difference.</p><p>Like a mini Indiana Jones, I spent most of my pre-teen years engaged in a sprawling search for exactly this. I read the beauty articles, stalked the CVS aisles, and spent my minimum wage earnings on products that promised to be the next big thing. And while some were decently effective, none came within throwing distance of working overnight. Spot correctors like <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/mario-badescu-drying-lotion-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mario Badescu's famous Drying Lotion</a> helped me recover faster, but it was still days at a time. Discovering an <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/differin-acne-gel-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">affordable version of Differin</a> in my mid-twenties helped me manage surface-level bumps within two days. And a chance discovery of this <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/aztec-bentonite-clay-mask-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">cult-favorite Aztec Clay Mask</a>&#160;with over 13,000 five-star reviews has helped me stop most breakouts before they happen.</p><p>But that still leaves the only kind of pimples I really cared about anyway — the ones that were a bit more severe than a light, surface-level irritation, and which you'd probably see someone's eyes wander to in a conversation.&#160;</p><p><strong>That's what I swear by Mighty Patch for, which I <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/products-we-bought-from-our-coworkers-reviews\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bought immediately</a>&#160;after reading <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/mighty-patch-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this Insider Reviews review</a>. </strong></p><p>To be concise, <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-originaloriginal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Mighty Patch</a> is simply the best fast acne solution I've ever found. They're Hydrocolloid stickers that suck the gunk out of blemishes overnight (or, as we'll get into later, during the day) if left on top of the blemish for a minimum of six hours. Originally used to treat wounds, hydrocolloid is a super-absorbent material now being put to use in gentle acne treatments — first in South Korea, where Hero Cosmetics' CEO and Co-Founder Ju Rhyu discovered them, and now in the US thanks in part to Rhyu's startup.</p><p>I put a Mighty Patch on at night before bed and wake up to a blemish that seems to have skipped three days of healing; it's not inflamed or raised, and it no longer appears to be active. They're gentle (vegan, alcohol-, paraben-, and sulfate-free), simple, and keep the germs from the outside world and your wandering hands away so blemishes can heal and stay healed. It's my personal \"magic beans\" product.</p><p>And now, Hero Cosmetics has released a Mighty Patch that can be worn during the day: <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">the Invisible+ patches</a>. They're transparent, ultra-thin, matte to avoid reflecting light, and have tapered edges that blend seamlessly into the skin (find comparative photos below)<strong>. </strong>Now, you can treat pimples in as little as six hours, no matter when they appear — no waiting for the cloak of night to get down to business.&#160;</p><h2>How to use Invisible+ Mighty Patches</h2><p>Cleanse the skin, pat it dry, and apply the mighty patch on top of your blemish. Leave it on for a minimum of six hours, either during the day or overnight if you choose. Remove it to throw away once the patch has turned opaque (aka sucked up all the impurities from that spot of your skin).&#160;</p><h2><strong>What the Invisible+ Mighty Patches are like in person</strong></h2><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f5fbd0f9900001939ee58?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mighty Patch Original vs. the Might Patch Invisible\" height=\"2607\" width=\"3476\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Left: Mighty Patch Original.\nRight: Invisible&#43; Mighty Patch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mara Leighton/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>The Invisible+ Mighty Patches are the same technology as the originals, but much less conspicuous. They're thinner, more transparent (the originals have a yellowish hue) and matte so they don't catch and reflect light. They have tapered edges to help the patch blend more seamlessly into the skin. If you wear them during the day, you can add a bit of concealer on top to camouflage it effectively and avoid makeup being absorbed into the blemish.</p><p>If the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Invisible+ patch</a> is prominently featured (i.e. smack dab in the middle of your face), though, it's not going to magically look like skin close up. Having said that, though, it's preferable to me between making things worse with just concealer and going sans anything at all. And it'll likely go unnoticed in casual interactions — perfect for doing damage control on a surprise breakout while traveling, beach days, running errands, before a big job interview or date, or pretty much any other time. I've used them last-minute to address a surprise blemish in the morning and afternoon so I could go out with clear skin at night.&#160;</p><p>Plus, the box includes two size options, so you can opt for a smaller patch for less severe blemishes. And, given their cult status, most people won't know what they are, and they're more likely to assume it's got more to do with a bandage than an active acne solution. But, ultimately, it's also good to note that it's not the end of the word even if someone does notice: as Hero Cosmetics' CEO Ju Rhyu, reminded me, \"over 60 million Americans suffer from acne at some point so even though we hate it when we break out, it's a fairly normal thing.\" More often than not, we're all in the same boat.</p><p>My one cautionary note is to check them more frequently while you're out in the daylight if you don't dab concealer on top — once they turn opaque, they're much more noticeable, and you'll probably want to take it off.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c7865ca26289844e6689f84?format=jpeg\" alt=\"collagehgkhjlkhjllhjl\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Left: Invisible&#43; Mighty Patch. Right: Mighty Patch Original.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hero Cosmetics/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><h2>Price</h2><p>A one-time purchase is <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">$17.99 for 39 patches on Hero Cosmetics</a> and <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Mighty-Patch-Invisible-Hydrocolloid-Absorbing/dp/B07KJS13PK/ref=as_li_ss_tl?keywords=hero+cosmetics+invisible+patches&qid=1551387569&s=gateway&sr=8-1-fkmrnull&th=1&linkCode=sl1&tag=biip_022819_invisible-mighty-patch-20&linkId=6e9e9258d0def993b895c4cca4d6edd9&language=en_US5c4cca4d6edd9&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Amazon</a>. Or, you can <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">go with a subscription</a> (opting for a box every 30, 45, or 60 days) and save 20% [You pay $14.39].</p><p>The Mighty Patch isn't as cheap as some of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cheap-skin-care-products-prevent-acne\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">our other favorite acne solutions</a>, but it is worth the extra money. It's gentle on the skin, relatively inconspicuous (as opposed to spot solutions), and it dwarfs blemishes overnight.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c786638262898457d320656?format=jpeg\" alt=\"41&#43; EJbehEL\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>When first applied, the Invisible&#43; patches are thin enough to be camouflaged.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hero Cosmetics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><h2>How to get free boxes or store credit</h2><p>You may end up buying them on Amazon, but Hero Cosmetics also has a <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&clickref=biip_022819_invisible-mighty-patch&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Faccount%2Flogin%3Freturn_url%3D%252Faccount%252Faccount\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">loyalty program with perks that you can join</a>. Sign up with an email, and if you spend $1, you get 1 point. After 75 points, you'll get a free box of the originals, or $13 credit. With 150 points, you get one box of the originals and one of the Invisible+ or $31 dollars credit. If you'd rather earn points faster, refer a friend and earn 20 at once.</p><h2>The bottom line</h2><p>All in all, the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=17095&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.herocosmetics.us%2Fproducts%2Fmighty-patch-invisiblenvisible\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Invisible+</a> are a bit less conspicuous than the originals, most so when they're first applied. However, if they're working, both the originals and the Invisible+ will eventually turn opaque and be far easier to spot — though, for what it's worth, the thinness of the Invisible+ is still less noticeable overall. For instance, having used both, I wouldn't wear the Mighty Patch Original out in public because of their thickness and color. I would, however, wear the Invisible+ in public if I thought I could get away with it based on the location of my acne.</p><p>Depending on your comfort level and where you need it (side of the face, chin, forehead underneath a baseball cap, etc.) and where you're going (beach, airplane, running errands) the still-there visibility may not matter anyway. Either way you break it down, the fact remains: the efficacy of the Mighty Patch is worth it. The added subtlety of the Invisible+ is worth it if you plan to wear them during the day or out in public.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e948cb329d6d96fac390994\" style=\"position:relative; 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Goldman Sachs senior strategist warns stocks could see 'considerable' pre-election downside that isn't being factored into models","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-downside-considerable-before-election-goldman-models-volatility-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f5e7a0f9900001939ee51?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Abby Joseph Cohen\" height=\"1686\" width=\"3372\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.reutersconnect.com/all?id=tag%3Areuters.com%2C2009%3Anewsml_GM1E56F1QCR01%3A1194070626&#38;search=all%3Aabby%20joseph%20cohen\" target=\"_blank\">Brendan McDermid/Reuters</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Goldman Sachs' Abby Joseph Cohen told Bloomberg on Thursday that markets could see \"considerable downside\" before the election due to factors that financial models aren't picking up.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>These factors include the outcome of the election and what Congress and the president will do next before election day, Cohen said.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>The senior investment strategist added that the market is vulnerable to volatility and disappointment given the\"wide gaps\" in the relative valuation of stocks. </strong></li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/international?r=US&IR=T?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingesttm_medium=ingest\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</strong></a><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Goldman Sachs' Abby Joseph Cohen <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2020-10-08/goldman-s-abby-joseph-cohen-sees-s-p-500-modestly-undervalued-video\">told Bloomberg on Thursday</a> that markets could soon see \"considerable downside\" based on factors that financial models cannot predict.</p><p>What Congress will do next, what the president will say, and how the election will end cannot be forecasted by modeling, the senior investment strategist said.</p><p>\"Those of us who have lived our professional lives really focusing in on the math, I think should feel very humble right now,\" Cohen said. \"Because what we recognize is that the models may not be able to properly reflect all of the volatility not just in the markets, but in the economy, in policy, and of course in investor sentiment.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-snowflake-barrick-gold-shareholder-brian-gongol-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"3\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway shocked investors with its Snowflake and Barrick Gold bets. A veteran shareholder explains why they might be part of a new strategy</a></em></p><p>While Cohen said that it's not unusual for volatility to rise before an election, there's also been \"erratic movement\" with regard to fiscal policy. Stocks quickly sold off on Tuesday after Trump tweeted that negotiations for the next stimulus plan would be halted until the election.&#160;</p><p>The famed strategist also said there are \"wide gaps\" in the relative valuation of stocks. Just a handful of stocks drove the market's record rally following its March lows. Cohen said this can make the market more volatile, and more vulnerable to disappointments.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 19:25:41 Graffeo)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7f5e7a0f9900001939ee51?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eTZLZtgcrMM:NNIonOAkb6c:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn34@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-34-504_3b0943ac5ca71ed1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eTZLZtgcrMM:NNIonOAkb6c:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn39@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-26-657_b261794947f59600.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eTZLZtgcrMM:NNIonOAkb6c:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn52@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-29-032_53c331a709a1fc52.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eTZLZtgcrMM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-25-770_cbc3161cbd145504.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360896},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Rock-bottom interest rates before the pandemic made the coronavirus recession worse, Fed's Rosengren says","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/economic-outlook-low-interest-rates-worsened-coronavirus-recession-fed-rosengren-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4d63282c500018c7969f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Eric Rosengren\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Boston Federal Reserve President Eric Rosengren (R) talks to FOX Business Network Correspondent Edward Lawrence during &#34;Making Money with Charles Payne&#34; at Fox Business Network Studios on September 20, 2019 in New York City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Slaven Vlasic/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>The historically low interest rates seen before the coronavirus pandemic worsened the current recession by driving&#160;a wave of bankruptcies, Eric Rosengren, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, said Thursday.</strong></li><li><strong>The central bank's benchmark rate sat at roughly 1.5% before the Fed dragged it near zero in March.</strong></li><li><strong>The low-rate environment led investors to take on more risk for higher yields and encouraged businesses to offer up more debt.</strong></li><li><strong>That build-up of risk \"likely will make economic recovery from the pandemic more difficult,\" he said, as leverage throughout the virus-slammed economy fueled defaults and kept firms from tapping relief programs.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Historically low interest rates in place before the coronavirus pandemic exacerbated the current economic slump, Eric Rosengren, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, said Thursday.</p><p>The central bank's benchmark rate sits near zero and is expected to stay there through 2024. Yet interest rates weren't much higher before the pandemic slammed the US economy and forced nationwide lockdowns. The federal funds rate hovered around 1.5% in late 2019 after three rate cuts through the second half of last year.</p><p>The pre-pandemic low-rate environment led investors to take on more risk in search of higher yields. Businesses met the demand with new debt offerings. That behavior is now coming back to bite all of the US, Rosengren said in prepared remarks for an online event with Marquette University.</p><p>\"The slow build-up of risk in the low-interest-rate environment that preceded the current recession likely will make the economic recovery from the pandemic more difficult,\" he said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-snowflake-barrick-gold-shareholder-brian-gongol-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway shocked investors with its Snowflake and Barrick Gold bets. A veteran shareholder explains why they might be part of a new strategy</a></em></p><p>For reference, the rate stood at roughly 5.25% immediately before the Great Recession. The Fed slashed its rate close to zero during the financial crisis and maintained that level until late 2015.</p><p>A build-up in risk can intensify downturns, as levered businesses can more easily default on debt when facing a slowdown in business activity and, in turn, revenue. Greater leverage throughout the economy also kept many firms from participating in emergency lending programs. In all, risk-taking is \"a contributing factor to the bankruptcies we have already seen, unfortunately with more quite likely in the coming months,\" Rosengren said.</p><p>The US lacks the regulatory tools needed to moderate risk build-ups down the road, he added. Failing to research risk-taking behaviors threatens an even worse wave of bankruptcies down the road.</p><p>\"If we expect to remain in a low-interest-rate environment for a protracted period of time, we need to take more precautions against financial stability risks for when the next economic shock hits,\" Rosengren said.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/imf-economic-outlook-lifting-lockdowns-risk-economic-recovery-coronavirus-cases-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Lifting lockdowns is unlikely to boost the economic recovery as long as cases remain elevated, IMF says</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-outlook-tech-sector-faang-rebound-reasons-strategist-shah-2020-10-1029662704\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">A top Wall Street strategist lays out 3 reasons tech stocks will surge even higher</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-analysis-q3-earnings-season-preview-revisions-tobias-levkovich-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Citi's US equities chief warns of an 'extreme peak' in earnings revisions heading into the crucial reporting season —&#160;and explains why it makes stocks vulnerable to a pullback in the weeks ahead</a></strong></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=DOupzOWkrEg:rbalHjD9FVs:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=DOupzOWkrEg:rbalHjD9FVs:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DOupzOWkrEg:rbalHjD9FVs:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/DOupzOWkrEg\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 08 Oct 2020 19:09:19 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4d6dc655f6001969f00d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"881e18c540b22cca945f83fa5806c981","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-23-111_26e142fa00c63317.webp","destWidth":2217,"destHeight":1663,"sourceBytes":208732,"destBytes":208732,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4d63282c500018c7969f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn35@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-33-697_cd441a84b8dbadab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DOupzOWkrEg:rbalHjD9FVs:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn83@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-35-089_402b5f29e986adae.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DOupzOWkrEg:rbalHjD9FVs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn61@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-26-814_211ca3928a2be886.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DOupzOWkrEg:rbalHjD9FVs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn97@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-27-974_dc0abdda9f1aeb8c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/DOupzOWkrEg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn61@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-33-272_ee47f49df86b8f65.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360898},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Megalodons may have grown to the size of school buses by eating their shark siblings in the womb, new research suggests","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-megalodon-sharks-got-so-big-what-they-ate-research-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5771e8e8dd089588228b498a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"megalodon shark week\" height=\"\" width=\"\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An illustration of a megalodon.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Megalodons &#8212; huge, prehistoric sharks &#8212; reached lengths of 50 feet, with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/megalodon-sharks-size-car-length-heads-fins-tall-as-people-2020-9\">heads the size of cars</a>.</li>\n<li>The predators are super-sized compared to other sharks, both living and extinct. But how megalodons achieved that massive size is a mystery.</li>\n<li>A new study suggests the sharks' size could be explained in part by the fact that they ate each other in the womb.</li>\n<li>Scientists aren't sure how megalodons hunted, but a decline in prey and an increase in competitors may have caused their extinction.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A megalodon's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/megalodon-sharks-size-car-length-heads-fins-tall-as-people-2020-9\">head alone was the size of a car</a>.</p><p>The prehistoric monster was largest meat-eating shark to ever roam the oceans: It reached lengths of 50 feet, with dorsal fins that jutted 5 feet out of the water.</p><p>The ancient predator has been thrown into a cultural and scientific spotlight in the last few years after nearly a dozen new studies and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/director-of-the-meg-set-out-to-make-the-most-fun-movie-of-the-summer-2018-8\">a 2018 Hollywood blockbuster</a> revitalized interest in the \"Meg.\"</p><p>Researching the creature is difficult, since all we have left of the \"Meg\" are its 6-inch long, serrated teeth. That makes it challenging for scientists to figure out how how large these creatures actually got and why they were able to reach such enormous sizes.</p><p>But new studies that examine Megs' descendants are helping us understand the prehistoric shark's size in new ways.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.eurekalert.org/emb_releases/2020-10/tfg-bso092120.php\">One analysis</a>, published on Monday, suggests that baby megalodons may have set themselves up to get super-sized before they're even born.</p><p>Meg eggs hatch inside the womb, where they grew ever bigger and hungrier before their mothers give live birth. But not all embryos survive the gestation process: Some are eaten by their womb-mates.</p><p>\"'Early-hatched' embryos will begin to eat surrounding unhatched eggs,\" Kenshu Shimada, lead author of the study and a professor of paleobiology at DePaul University, told Business Insider. \"The consequence is that only a few pups will survive and develop, but each of those pups can become considerably large in body size at birth.\"</p><h2>Elusive fossil evidence makes the Meg's size 'hard to pin down'</h2><h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f734a650ab50d00184acfa1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"meg tooth shimada\" height=\"584\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Paleobiologist Kenshu Shimada holds a tooth of an extinct shark Otodus megalodon, or the so-called &#34;Meg.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Kenshu Shimada/DePaul University/Jeff Carrion</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></h2><p>Shimada's group first wanted to pin down how big megalodons could get.</p><p>So the researchers looked at how Meg's modern relatives, called lamniforms, live today. These sharks — which include great whites, makos, and sand tigers — have the same diet and body type as Meg did. So Shimada measured the size ratio between those sharks' teeth and body proportions, then applied that comparison to <a href=\"https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwiwx7jD6ZPsAhWDknIEHbGYCVEQFjAMegQICRAC&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Fmegalodon-teeth-found-in-flooded-cave-mexico-2019-11&usg=AOvVaw3N8FWyKdxlcJ_HU64l8LQD-11&#38;usg=AOvVaw3N8FWyKdxlcJ_HU64l8LQD\">fossilized megalodon teeth</a>.</p><p>That revealed that the maximum length a Meg could get is about 50 feet (15 meters) — more than double the length of a great white, the biggest carnivorous shark alive today.</p><p>\"This does not mean that Megalodon individuals larger than 15 meters did not exist, but their existence has not been substantiated based on scientific specimens in museum collections,\" Shimada said.</p><p>Indeed, a group of UK researchers did similar tooth-body comparisons in <a href=\"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-020-71387-y\">a September study</a>, and found that megalodons could have been 52 feet long. That research also showed that a 52-foot (16-meter) megalodon had a head and tail 13 feet (4 meters) long, and a dorsal fin equal to the height of an average woman.<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f734f7374fe5b0018a8df46?format=jpeg\" alt=\"megalodon fin\" height=\"340\" width=\"576\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Comparison of a reconstruction of an adult megalodon&#39;s dorsal fin to a 5-foot-tall diver.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Oliver Oliver E. Demuth</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"It has been hard to pin down these dimensions because we only have teeth remains,\" Catalina Pimiento, an author of that September study, told Business Insider.</p><p>Scattered vertebrae exist, but scientists have yet to find any other bones, since sharks' soft, cartilaginous skeletons rarely survive fossilization.</p><p>\"It may be we will never find a complete skeleton,\" added Mike Benton, Pimiento's co-author.&#160;</p><h2>Cannibal megalodons</h2><p>Given the paucity of fossils, scientists are forced to make educated guesses about what influenced megalodons' lives and diets using their modern counterparts.</p><p>There are, in theory, two ways a shark can get enough food to become as gigantic as the Meg: either they become filter-feeders and munch on abundant plankton, like whale sharks do, or they gain the ability to control their own body temperatures, which improves their hunting skills.</p><p>A <a href=\"https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2019-01/su-rsw012419.php\">January 2019 study</a> from Pimiento's group suggested that megalodons followed the latter route: They were mesothermic, meaning they could regulate the temperature of their organs. This enabled the sharks to live in colder waters and swim faster — and therefore catch more prey.</p><p>Mesothermy was \"a key driver in the evolution of its gigantic size,\" Pimiento said.</p><p>What drove these sharks to become mesothermic? Shimada thinks the key to answering that question has to do with the way lamniforms&#160;give birth.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f734ed40ab50d00184acfd4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"megalodon\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2700\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jaws of Carcharocles megalodon, an extinct species of shark that lived from about 23 to 3.6 million years ago.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Florida Museum photo by Kristen Grace</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>A female lamniforms' eggs hatch inside her body, then the pups develop in her womb before being born. The babies that hatch early have the benefit of getting to eat their unhatched brothers and sisters — a process called \"intrauterine cannibalism.\"</p><p>Sometimes, like in sandtiger sharks, hatched pups will eat their litter mates after they're born, too.</p><p>Given that lamniforms are related to megalodons, Shimada said the same rules likely applied to the prehistoric predators.</p><p>In the new study, his group suggested that such cannibalism could've kickstarted megalodons' mesothermy: The task of nurturing a small number of gigantic offspring — well fed on their siblings' blood — in their wombs may have prompted Meg moms to eat more. And in order to eat more, they needed to either switch to a plankton diet, or crank up their internal temperatures to hunt better.</p><h2>'Its hunting style was likely a single-strike tactic'</h2><p>The prehistoric shark's teeth can tell us more about how Megs preferred to hunt.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2019-03/fmon-hmt030419.php\">One study</a> suggested in March 2019 that the sharks liked to bite hard then step back. Adult megalodons packed a bite force of 11 tons.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f734ed374fe5b0018a8df43?format=jpeg\" alt=\"megalodon\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A megalodon&#39;s blade-ike, serrated teeth were ideal for preying on fleshy marine mammals like whales and dolphins.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Florida Museum photo by Kristen Grace</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"Megalodon's teeth suggest its hunting style was likely a single-strike tactic, designed to immobilize its prey and allow it to bleed out,\" Victor Perez, the lead author of that study, said in a release. He added: \"A shark wouldn't want to grab and hold onto a whale because it's going to thrash about and possibly injure the shark in the process.\"</p><p>Researchers have discovered megalodon bite marks on marine mammal bones, but whether those remarks represent predatory attacks or scavenging activities is still unknown, according to Shimada.</p><h2>Dwindling prey and competition with other sharks may have caused the Meg's extinction</h2><p>The biggest megalodon mystery has little to do with its size, however. Paleobiologists like Shimada and Pimiento still aren't sure how the shark went extinct.</p><p>Megalodons dominated the oceans for 20 million years before disappearing from the fossil record between 3.6 and 2.6 million years ago. Theories about their abrupt extinction run the gamut.</p><p>A <a href=\"https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2018-12/uok-dsk121118.php\">2018 paper</a> posited that fallout from a supernova 150 light-years away dosed megalodons in deadly radiation. <a href=\"https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2019-02/uowo-gs021219.php\">Another study</a> suggested the newly evolved great white shark out-competed them.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f734d5c0ab50d00184acfcc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A great white shark at Guadalupe Island, Mexico.\" height=\"2792\" width=\"3723\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A great white shark at Guadalupe Island, Mexico.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Gerald Schömbs/Unsplash</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Pimiento said megalodons' extinction did indeed coincide with the appearance of great whites and orca whales, but at the same time, there was a decline in marine mammals — their preferred prey —&#160;as <a href=\"https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/jbi.12754\">global sea levels</a> dropped.</p><p>As the Meg jockeyed with more competitors for less prey in a shrinking ocean habitat, its fate was sealed.</p><h2>Some people think the Meg still roams the oceans, but scientists disagree</h2><p>In the 2018 film \"The Meg,\" Jason Statham battles a megalodon that, according to the story, appears in modern times after swimming out of the depths of the Marianas Trench in the Pacific Ocean. The movie was based on the 1997 book, \"Meg: A Novel of Deep Terror.\"</p><p>Benton said that, although the idea that a Meg could suddenly appear in today's oceans isn't believable, the on-screen shark's dimensions match his recent study's findings.</p><p>\"I guess the book and movie got the size about right, and much of the behaviour was OK being based on the modern great white shark,\" he said.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b6af6e52be4ab1e2f8b4731?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Meg 2 Warner Bros.\" height=\"858\" width=\"1716\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A shot of the megalodon in the 2018 movie &#34;The Meg.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Warner Bros.</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Steve Alten, the author of \"Meg,\" told Business Insider his fans constantly ask him whether he believes the creatures are still alive.</p><p>\"My response is always the same,\" he said. \"Because so much of the oceans remain unexplored, the possibility remains they could be out there in deep water.\"</p><p>Benton agreed it's \"perfectly reasonable\" for people to ask the question.</p><p>\"Oceanographers drag all sorts of amazing things out of the deep oceans. Think about the <a href=\"https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2019-04/fu-fto041619.php\">coelacanth</a>, long thought to be extinct, but found alive for the first time in 1938,\" he said.</p><p>But he and Pimiento both said that if a megalodon was out still out there, researchers probably would have found it already.</p><p>\"Most sharks live in shallow, coastal waters — not deep ocean, like the coelacanth,\" Benton said. \"It was a big beast, so I'd be amazed if we had missed it.\"&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Woodward)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5771e8e8dd089588228b498a?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f734a650ab50d00184acfa1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn63@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-28-890_85e715a4e4326b1a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f734f7374fe5b0018a8df46?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f734ed40ab50d00184acfd4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn90@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-25-350_ab2389728675f29f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f734ed374fe5b0018a8df43?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn73@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-26-670_cf127285ccff7465.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f734d5c0ab50d00184acfcc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn40@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-25-693_78a9476caea59a65.webp","https://i.insider.com/5b6af6e52be4ab1e2f8b4731?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn88@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-26-056_89c0543f8b87e83c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BvCNrCnKjfI:r2_sX438X6g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn85@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-32-049_73bbddf0a5a2a872.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BvCNrCnKjfI:r2_sX438X6g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-29-987_a02706ed3d96600e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BvCNrCnKjfI:r2_sX438X6g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-35-073_f7963410d16ce492.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/BvCNrCnKjfI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn55@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-24-006_a1dfef4d6a66fc85.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360907},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Retailers like Ikea, Aldi, and Tractor Supply will open dozens of new stores in 2020 while others frantically shutter locations","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/retailers-opening-stores-2020-aldi-five-below-list-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f611a1e323fc4001e0d66bf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"aldi\" height=\"3648\" width=\"4864\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Aldi.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peter Nicholls/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Retailers have announced thousands of store closures this year as the coronavirus pandemic ravages an industry that was already facing its share of challenges.</li>\n<li>However, some retailers are still moving forward with plans to grow their store fleet in 2020.&#160;</li>\n<li>Among the retailers expanding their footprint are discount stores, grocery stores, and a rural lifestyle store.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Retailers have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stores-closing-in-2020-list-2020-1\">announced more than 6,300 store closures</a> this year, as the coronavirus pandemic upends an already challenged industry.&#160;</p><p>But some brands are still moving forward with plans to grow their footprint in 2020 despite those headwinds.</p><p>According to an analysis by Coresight Research, 3,344 new store openings have been announced so far this year. Among those retailers with plans to expand are discount and off-price stores, grocery stores, and \"the largest rural lifestyle retailer in the United States\" — Tractor Supply.</p><p>Here's a list of retailers that are growing their store fleet in 2020:&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tAmerican Eagle Outfitters plans to open 25 stores for its lifestyle brand Aerie this year, including two locations for Aerie's new sub-brand, Offline. At the same time, a number of American Eagle stores are expected to close.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1ede582618b92ce437b8a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"offline aerie\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Aerie launched Offline in July.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Offline by Aerie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4373291-american-eagle-outfitters-inc-aeo-ceo-jay-schottenstein-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call?part=single\">American Eagle Outfitters</a></em></p>\n\tOff-price retailer Ross Stores expects to open about 66 new locations by the end of the year. At the beginning of 2020, the company said it would open 100 new Ross Dress for Less and dd's DISCOUNTS stores.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e28c508b6d52d641a793506?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Miami Beach, Ross Department Store, check-out counter.\" height=\"1683\" width=\"2244\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ross Stores.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jeffrey Greenberg/Universal Images Group via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4370046-ross-stores-inc-rost-ceo-barbara-rentler-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single\">Ross Stores</a></em></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tOllie's Bargain Outlet has opened 23 stores so far in 2020, and expects to open about 50 total new locations by the end of the year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5de6c661fd9db23bc8109ec6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ollies bargain outlet mark butler\" height=\"3456\" width=\"4608\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ollie&#39;s Bargain Outlet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jonathan Weiss/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4371279-ollies-bargain-outlet-holdings-inc-olli-ceo-john-swygert-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call?part=single\">Ollie's Bargain Outlet</a></em></p>\n\tDiscount retailer Five Below has opened 84 new stores so far this year, and it expects to end the year with about 110 new locations.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dd2ba917eece533cc4df826?format=jpeg\" alt=\"five below\" height=\"1328\" width=\"1771\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Five Below.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/five-below-store-news-photo/454355756?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">John Greim/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4372258-five-below-inc-five-ceo-joel-anderson-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single\">Five Below</a></em></p>\n\tLidl, the German discount grocery chain, plans to invest more than $500 million to open 50 new stores by the end of 2021.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d6ff5052e22af480b541d04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lidl\" height=\"1304\" width=\"1739\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Lidl.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Leonhard Foeger/File Photo/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lidl-is-opening-50-new-stores-list-of-locations-2020-8\">Business Insider</a></em></p>\n\tOff-price retailer Burlington said it expects to open 62 new stores while also closing or relocating 26 stores. Meaning, it should have 36 net new locations by year's end.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6105f957b7da001ee11c84?format=jpeg\" alt=\"burlington stores\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Burlington.\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Greim/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4371193-burlington-stores-inc-burl-ceo-michael-osullivan-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single\">Burlington</a></em></p>\n\tDiscount grocery chain Aldi said in July that it planned to open an additional 70 new stores in the US by the end of 2020.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f611a1e323fc4001e0d66bf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"aldi\" height=\"3648\" width=\"4864\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Aldi.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peter Nicholls/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/aldi-defies-pandemic-closings-plans-to-open-another-70-stores-2020-7\">Business Insider</a></em></p>\n\tGap Inc. said it would be opening an undisclosed number of new Old Navy stores while shuttering underperforming Gap and Banana Republic stores.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e28ccd6b6d52d6db21dfa43?format=jpeg\" alt=\"old navy location \" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Old Navy.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/woman-carries-her-shopping-bag-as-she-exits-an-old-navy-news-photo/682347682?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4371288-gap-inc-gps-ceo-sonia-syngal-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single\">Gap Inc.</a></em></p>\n\tGap Inc. said it would also be growing its Athleta store fleet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f611b8757b7da001ee11d11?format=jpeg\" alt=\"athleta clothes\" height=\"2249\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Athleta.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bethany Biron/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4371288-gap-inc-gps-ceo-sonia-syngal-on-q2-2020-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single\">Gap Inc.</a></em></p>\n\tTractor Supply expects to open between 75 and 80 new stores in 2020. It opened 18 new locations in the quarter ending on June 27 while reporting record sales results amid the pandemic.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f62315d57b7da001ee11f70?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tractor supply\" height=\"932\" width=\"1246\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tractor Supply Co.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tractor Supply Co.</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://corporate.tractorsupply.com/newsroom/news-releases/news-releases-details/2020/Tractor-Supply-Company-Reports-Record-Sales-and-Earnings-for-Second-Quarter-2020/default.aspx\">Tractor Supply</a></em></p>\n\tIkea is opening 50 new smaller-format stores around the world this year, with a focus on major cities including New York, Los Angeles, and Chicago in the US.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6ba8bee3e76700117162bc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IKEA\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Sibley/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ikea-to-open-new-stores-urban-areas-cities-amid-pandemic-2020-10\">Business Welcome to the Insider Advertising daily for October 9. I'm Lauren Johnson, a senior advertising reporter at Business Insider. <a href=\"http://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-advertising\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">Subscribe here to get this newsletter in your inbox every weekday.</a> Send me feedback or tips at <a data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">ljohnson@businessinsider.com.</a></p><p><strong>Today's news: </strong>Paul Palmieri's new e-commerce startup, Expedia's PR scramble, and Amazon's plan to rewrite the retail calendar.</p><hr><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/adtech-vet-paul-palmieri-investor-deck-e-commerce-platform-2020-10\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f2e2a282c500018c79584?format=jpeg\" alt=\"group14434BW\" height=\"1033\" width=\"1377\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tradeswell</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></h3><section><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/adtech-vet-paul-palmieri-investor-deck-e-commerce-platform-2020-10\">Read the investor deck this adtech vet used to raise $3.3 million for what he calls 'the Bloomberg terminal' for the booming e-commerce industry</a></h3><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/adtech-vet-paul-palmieri-investor-deck-e-commerce-platform-2020-10\">Paul Palmieri, the former founder of mobile adtech company Millennial Media and VC firm Grit Capital, has raised $3.3 million in a seed round of funding for a new e-commerce startup called Tradeswell, reports Tanya Dua.</a></li><li>The company's investor pitch deck says that it can solve problems for e-commerce brands like marketing, retail, inventory, logistics and forecasting.</li><li>\"E-commerce could be a trillion-dollar opportunity but no one yet has built anything for the benefit of brands,\" said Palmieri. \"Tradeswell is like an AI layer that allows brands that trade goods on multiple channels to have a single platform that serves them — they get not just data, but also the context around that.\"</li></ul></section><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/adtech-vet-paul-palmieri-investor-deck-e-commerce-platform-2020-10\">Read the full story here.</a></h3><hr><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/expedia-looked-for-pr-help-following-coronavirus-troubles-2020-10\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f29e0282c500018c79564?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Expedia Mobile App\" height=\"3648\" width=\"4864\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">svetlichniy_igor/shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/expedia-looked-for-pr-help-following-coronavirus-troubles-2020-10\">Expedia sought PR help after pandemic-related cancellations led to scores of disappointed customers</a></h3><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/expedia-looked-for-pr-help-following-coronavirus-troubles-2020-10\">A leaked document shows how Expedia sought PR help to repair its reputation after the coronavirus hit the travel industry, Sean Czarnecki reports.</a></li><li>The RFP issued in the spring states that Expedia saw \"5-7 times our usual volumes, even in our busiest times and equates to hundreds of thousands of calls.\"</li><li>The brief called for a firm to help with PR and social media and potentially work with Expedia's creative agency of record with the goal of hiring an agency by mid-May, but the company acknowledged that the process could be altered.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/expedia-looked-for-pr-help-following-coronavirus-troubles-2020-10\">Read the full story here.</a></h3><hr><section><h1><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-prime-day-dominating-the-retail-calendar-2020-10\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1043083ad86129bc48b6b7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: Prompts on how to use Amazon&#39;s Alexa personal assistant are seen in an Amazon ‘experience centre’ in Vallejo, California, U.S., May 8, 2018. REUTERS/Elijah Nouvelage/File Photo\" height=\"2333\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>FILE PHOTO: Prompts on how to use Amazon&#39;s Alexa personal assistant are seen in an Amazon ‘experience centre’ in Vallejo\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></h1><h1><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-prime-day-dominating-the-retail-calendar-2020-10\">Amazon moving Prime Day to October is the latest example of the e-commerce giant's dominance of the retail calendar</a></h1><ul><li>Amazon is pushing back its annual Prime Day sale to next week because of the coronavirus.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-prime-day-dominating-the-retail-calendar-2020-10\">The move shows Amazon's growing sway over the retail business with Target and Walmart also planned to have similar sales, Áine Cain reports.</a></li><li>In response to the coronavirus pandemic, Amazon moved its&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-prime-day-best-deals\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"94216b73c468d3ef705b15f3a4cee06d\">Prime Day sales</a>&#160;events to mid-October.</li><li>\"Amazon commands such a significant share of retail and is growing so rapidly that I think retailers have to be aware and have to compete,\" said Edward Jones retail analyst Brian Yarmouth.</li></ul></section><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-prime-day-dominating-the-retail-calendar-2020-10\">Read the full story here.</a></h3><hr><h3><strong>More stories we're reading:</strong></h3><section><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/soulcycle-scandal-ceo-melanie-whelan-spin-bullying-peloton-equinox-2020-9\">After expensing $5,100 in Dior bags, SoulCycle's CEO was suddenly out. Now, an executive exodus and a culture war threaten to send the company off a cliff.</a> (Business Insider)</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/instagram-reels-details-for-influencers-brands-and-marketers-2020-10\">How to use Instagram Reels effectively, according to influencers, brands, and marketers</a> (Business Insider)</li><li><a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/warnermedia-plans-thousands-of-job-cuts-in-restructuring-11602182057\">WarnerMedia plans thousands of job cuts in restructuring</a> (Wall Street Journal)</li><li><a href=\"https://www.axios.com/nyt-debuts-new-ad-program-to-help-brands-address-sensitive-topics-f022472a-fd28-45d6-a45d-9157340af381.html\">NYT debuts new ad program to help brands address sensitive topics</a> (Axios)</li><li><a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/08/trump-biden-pacs-spend-big-on-facebook-as-election-nears.html\">Why political campaigns are flooding Facebook with ad dollars</a> (CNBC)</li></ul></section><section></section><section><p>Thanks for reading and see you on Monday!
