2020 18:31:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7e2843282c500018c7939e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"38ac614859580d658634cca81038b346","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn15@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-22-833_6188d840e075a03b.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":144814,"destBytes":144814,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7e2850282c500018c7939f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn64@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-25-261_09a41acae43f5103.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7e24d1282c500018c79382?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn36@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-26-602_57becc9c03f60ceb.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7e254b282c500018c79385?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn94@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-32-176_5529fe8badaa7ab1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7e25adc655f6001969ecb4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn31@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-25-676_beffa154cae262c2.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7e2613c655f6001969ecb6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn67@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-33-473_85a3472f0e34bf62.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=i_IYdQ5AMi0:-SMHElr_DXo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-33-759_586a7e658e5f876f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=i_IYdQ5AMi0:-SMHElr_DXo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-30-973_db56130a7d20bbdd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=i_IYdQ5AMi0:-SMHElr_DXo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn23@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-35-365_86cefea886388d13.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/i_IYdQ5AMi0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn48@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-31-769_b52091b20af8ef60.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360906},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"I stayed at Hotel Monteleone and visited its Carousel Bar, both of which are treasured New Orleans landmarks — here's how they've adapted to the pandemic","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-hotel-review-new-orleans","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cae37282c500018c78e8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone lobby\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Booking.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hotel Monteleone</a> in New Orleans reopened last month after a temporary closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic</li><li>I booked a stay to see how it adapted to new changes, as well as to take advantage of the central location and historic ambiance.</li><li>I stayed in an entry-level <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">King Room</a> for $151 per night, which was priced far cheaper than is typical for this iconic hotel.</li><li>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-hotels-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Is it safe to stay in a hotel right now? An infectious disease doctor, a cleaning expert, and hotel reps all share what you should know before you check-in.</a></li><li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals</a>.</li></ul><p>New Orleans has taken an especially cautious approach to the COVID-19 pandemic. In a city known for raucous nightlife, many bars and restaurants shut down or operated under heavy restrictions as the city experienced peak infection rates.</p><p>However, New Orleans responded responsibly, and as cases dipped, the historic French Quarter began to slowly and carefully reopen. Restaurants welcome patrons to distanced, courtyard dining and bars now sell to-go drinks.</p><p>With so much recent change, I decided to get a closer read on how local hospitality has adapted in my hometown, and&#160;checked into the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hotel Monteleone</a> for one night. This iconic property is one of the city's oldest, most celebrated hotels.</p><p>In fact, I consider it among <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hotels-new-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New Orleans' best hotels</a> and a rarity, as an independent luxury property that is in its fifth generation of family ownership. It's a beloved spot for locals like myself, as well as visitors, for its famed Carousel Bar that's become something of a New Orleans landmark.&#160;</p><p>It opened in 1886 with 64 rooms and expanded over the decades to its current tally of 570 rooms, making it one of the largest in the city. It comes with a proud literary history: Ernest Hemingway, Tennessee Williams, and William Faulkner all stayed here regularly, and Truman Capote (falsely) claimed to have been born here.</p><p>After a short closure, the hotel is now open again, and with attractive prices far cheaper than is the norm. I booked an entry-level <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Traditional King room</a> for $151 for one night, which was a good $50 below the amount I might usually expect to pay for a midweek booking.</p><p>Most of the amenities, such as the pool, restaurant and spa were open, albeit with restrictions to keep guests safe. This was my first New Orleans hotel stay since the pandemic began, and it turned out to not only be a great value, but reassuring and reviving, and I would gladly return with confidence. Read on to find out why.</p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-1\">The first impression</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-5\">The room</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-9\">On-site amenities</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-13\">What's nearby</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-14\">What others say</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-15\">What you need to know</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-monteleone-review-new-orleans#-16\">The bottom line</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book The Hotel Monteleone starting at $151 per night</a></li></ul><h2>Keep reading to see why I was so impressed by <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.htmle.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">The Hotel Monteleone</a>.&#160;</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d979252a4107d1284547da7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1 Hotel Reviews Banner first impression\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cbe8594fce90018f7b73a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone exterior\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The hotel&#39;s main entrance from Royal Street, which was far less bustling than usual.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Early signs of a somewhat subdued atmosphere were apparent straight away as I rolled up to the beautiful Beaux-Arts building. There's usually a phalanx of uniformed doormen and lobby staff busily opening car doors and stacking up luggage carts.</p><p>Now, that was reduced to a solitary member of staff. But even the presence of one person was somewhat reassuring.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f5962e4029f001876057e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Monteleone lobby\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The large lobby is open, grand, and inviting.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The twin doorways had been designated as exclusively an entrance and an exit respectively, pre-empting any logistical snarl-ups, and I stepped into the grand lobby.</p><p>Not much was immediately different, although it was noticeably quiet. Usually at 3 p.m., even on a Wednesday, there would be a hive of activity, with tourists and locals brandishing to-go cocktails and a line of people checking in.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cbffe282c500018c78f18?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone hand sanitizer station\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Hand sanitizer stations are available in the lobby.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Instead, I was the sole guest. On closer inspection, I noticed hand sanitizer stations, roped barriers to marshal people in line, and place markers on the floor to keep people six feet apart.</p><p>As I was the only person checking in, I didn't feel crowded or unsafe. Every member of staff I saw was masked, including the lobby assistant outside the property.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cc1e094fce90018f7b75a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone lobby\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The front desk now has plastic barriers and signage for social distancing.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I was an hour early (regular check-in time is 4 p.m.), but the front desk was able to accommodate me immediately, and I had my room keys within minutes.</p><p>The entirety of the front desk was protected by clear plastic sheets, meaning that there was an additional barrier between guests and staff at all times, though communication was still very easy.</p><p>The current situation with amenities, restaurant and bar openings, and hotel policies on masks were all explained precisely and concisely. The only completely absent service as far as I could tell, was the removal of in-room dining.</p><p>As I completed my check-in, I also noticed that there was a dedicated desk with a sign saying Health &#38; Medical Assistance, complete with a uniformed medical professional there throughout the day to assist guests with any additional concerns.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d979264d831b2141f07abd1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2 Hotel Reviews Banner The room\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cc2e494fce90018f7b763?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone bedroom\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My Traditional King Room was compact, but comfortable, with regal design accents.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I booked the hotel's standard, entry-level <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Traditional King room</a>.</p><p>I was allocated one on the 14th floor, the highest floor for regular guest rooms, though there is also a <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Penthouse Suite</a> on the 15th floor. The Monteleone has a good range of rooms, with 55 suites that vary in size and comfort between my room and the Penthouse. These suites, split into <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Executive and Literary</a>, are among the pricier options in town, but with correspondingly elevated levels of luxury.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Traditional rooms</a>, like my own, followed the general aesthetic of the hotel in that they are designed very traditionally.</p><p>This standard room type is 226 square feet, which felt ample enough thanks to the high ceilings. The decor was unswervingly traditional, with crown molding, and floral motifs around the bedding and on the curtains, which were thick and housed in a regal pelmet. It definitely felt like a timeless, historic French Quarter room.</p><p>The King-sized bed was slightly raised and came with high-count cotton linens and an overstuffed mattress that resulted in a comfortable night's sleep. The soundproofing on the windows (and in general) was noticeable, and none of the foot or motor traffic from the street or within the hotel itself was audible.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f59d6d5f23d001959518c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Monteleone room view\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The views from the 14th floor were stunning.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Additionally, from the 14th floor, the views over the French Quarter were as good as any in the city.</p><p>I also thought that the room matched up to the COVID-19 cleaning <a href=\"https://hotelmonteleone.com/covid-19-update-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">procedures</a> listed online. This included requiring 48 hours between guest stays, which meant the room immediately felt hygienic and appeared to be freshly sanitized. A sheet of paper on the bed summarized the same information given out at reception, with the opening times and procedures for the bar, restaurant, and other amenities.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cc450282c500018c78f36?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone bathroom\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My bathroom was stocked with Gilchrist and Soames toiletries, plus hand sanitizer.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>All unnecessary amenities had been stripped out, so there were no paper pads, pens, or extensive minibar or snacks.</p><p>In fact, the only amenities, which were both welcome, were two bottles of complimentary water in the mini-fridge and a small (1.25ml) bottle of hand sanitizer in the bathroom along with the toiletries, which was plenty given the length of my stay. Housekeeping, should I have stayed longer, would only be completed by request, with staff wearing masks.&#160;</p><p>The aforementioned toiletries were by Gilchrist and Soames, which maintained the high-end ambiance. The mixed marble and granite bathroom came stocked with plentiful thick towels and in-room robes.</p><p>Entry-level rooms come with one sink and a bathtub and shower combination. The water pressure and temperature were both pleasingly easy to control.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cc3c294fce90018f7b769?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone desk\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A small desk is available for additional seating or as a work space.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Other in-room features included a Keurig coffee maker, a flat screen TV, and fast complimentary Wi-Fi (with a paid option for even faster streaming). The armchair and in-room art were fairly unremarkable but perfectly acceptable.&#160;</p><p>Fans of more contemporary, sleek interior design would likely feel more comfortable elsewhere, but as an older property with almost a century and a half of history, the style choices were appropriate.</p><p>Although it's not the most modern room in the city, Monteleone's King room retains luxe standards and was well maintained. I did think there was room for modernization in terms of the technology available and the condition of some of the furniture, however.</p><p>I've also stayed in suites here before and can confirm there isn't too much difference in terms of decor levels and amenities. The suites are really only differentiated in that they offer more space. I would consider booking one of the suites only if I was traveling with a small family. For single travelers and couples, Traditional rooms are more than adequate.</p><p>Of course, a special occasion might deserve an upgrade to one of the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Literary Suites</a> with their parlors, wet bars, and period antiques. The largest of these, the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Tennessee Williams Suite, </a>offers a generous 1,104 square feet with rates generally in the $600-$1,000 per night range.</p><p>Yet, I only paid $151 before taxes and fees for my entry-level <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Traditional King room</a>, which was a good $50 below what I would expect to pay for a Wednesday night at this hotel during regular times. In my opinion, it's one of the best basic rooms in the city, with enviable views of the French Quarter, and inarguably a great value.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Compare room types and prices for The Hotel Monteleone</a></h2>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d9792784b6507152c489b99?format=jpeg\" alt=\"3 Hotel Reviews Banner On site amenities\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cd9db94fce90018f7b802?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone bar\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iconic Carousel Bar has reopened, but with new restrictions in place.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>All of the hotel's amenities, including the bar, restaurant, spa, pool, and exercise room, were open, albeit with sensible restrictions in place.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60864-d2194904-Reviews-Carousel_Bar-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">The Carousel Bar</a> is a French Quarter institution, with its famous fairground-style carousel that rotates as bar patrons sit on the 25 attached stools around the bar. It dates back to 1949 and is famed for its cocktails beyond the obvious design gimmick.</p><p>It would usually be brimming with locals and visitors from its opening at 11 a.m., but now operates only in the lounge area from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. with limited seating and reservations necessary. Patrons must also order food.</p><p>For old times' sake, I ordered a quick pre-dinner cocktail (they are famed for their Pimms Cups) and a plate of excellent White Truffle Fries. Staff were masked, and only two other tables were seated at the time, so there was plenty of personal space.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cda31282c500018c78fce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone criollo restaurant\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Breakfast is also available at the on-site restaurant Criollo.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hotel's contemporary restaurant, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60864-d3247195-Reviews-Criollo_Restaurant-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Criollo</a>, is only open for breakfast. The menu is a la carte and I dined there with just two or three other tables filled, meaning, there was plenty of social distancing.</p><p>The servers all wore masks, and it felt relaxed and safe. There's a full menu of the usual breakfast favorites, plus local dishes such as shrimp and grits ($23) and fried chicken and biscuit ($15).</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7cda96282c500018c78fd6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hotel monteleone pool\" height=\"1119\" width=\"1492\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool is also open, with plenty of social distancing.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hotel's rooftop pool is smallish by hotel standards, and although nobody was there when I went to use it, it looked like social distancing measures would be left to people's discretion.</p><p>The pool bar is open from 11 a.m., but with no bar seating. The exercise room was similarly empty and the spa was only open by appointment, so, it didn't seem like overcrowding would be a problem.</p><p>There's also a small on-site shop for coffee, souvenirs, and incidentals, which was open all day. Signs reminded guests that only one person was allowed into the shop at any one time.</p><p>In all, I felt that the hotel was doing a responsible job of addressing public health concerns., offering guests as many amenities as possible without being careless.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d97928ad831b2140609a1c0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"4 Hotel Reviews Banner What&#39;s nearby\" height=\"151\" width=\"1201\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hotel's location is one of its big selling points. Staying here puts guests right in the French Quarter, and being on Royal Street is especially evocative, surrounded by the city's best antique shops.</p><p>The shopping, dining, and nightlife of the Quarter are all easily walkable, and at the time of my visit, the early stages of phase three reopening were being implemented, meaning some dining and to-go drinks reinstated at bars. These situations change on a weekly basis, though.</p><p>In any scenario, the Mississippi River is just a block or so from the hotel and makes for very pleasant evening walks, as does just walking around the French Quarter with its evocative historic architecture.</p><h2><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.expedia.com%2FCheap-Flights-To-New-Orleans.d178292.Travel-Guide-Flights\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Check flight prices to New Orleans on Expedia</a></h2>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d97929ab15102103d15bdb7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"5 Hotel Reviews Banner What others say\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The Hotel Monteleone receives an 'excellent' 4.5 out of 5 on <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60864-d89148-Reviews-Hotel_Monteleone-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Trip Advisor</a> and is ranked 21 out of 177 Hotels in New Orleans with just over 9,800 reviews. Guests praise the location, room sizes, and its general old-world charm.</p><p>One guest's reaction to the hotel's classic grandeur is typical: \"This is one of the most elegant hotels I have ever visited and would recommend to anyone soon as you walk through the front doors you see the beauty of the hotel.\"</p><p>The age of the hotel can sometimes throw up issues with hot water and electrical supplies, and some guests found the front desk customer service less than high end, citing possible cultural or language barriers.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60864-d89148-Reviews-Hotel_Monteleone-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Read reviews, compare prices, and book The Hotel Monteleone on TripAdvisor</a></h2>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d9792adb15102134748b70c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"6 Hotel Reviews Banner What you need to know\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Who stays here</strong>: The clientele definitely seems to skew more leisure than business, due to its location and historic ambiance. As such, the hotel draws a more mature crowd, people with an interest in local history and the literary associations of the hotel rather than a young party crowd. So, there's a civilized atmosphere.</p><p><strong>We like</strong>: The history of the hotel, with the display cases of literary memorabilia from Tennessee Williams, Truman Capote, and the like. They give a real sense of place and the cultural legacy of the property.</p><p><strong>We love (don't miss this feature!)</strong>: Ordering a Pimm's Cup and a bar snack at one of the country's most original bars, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60864-d2194904-Reviews-Carousel_Bar-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">The Carousel Bar</a>. It doesn't feel relentlessly touristy as so many locals also enjoy doing the exact same thing.</p><p><strong>We think you should know</strong>: The hotel is operating something of a skeleton service during COVID-19. Less lobby staff and reduced hours for the amenities, but at least these places are open and guests can experience some of the hotel, even if under stricter guidelines.</p><p><strong>We'd do this differently next time</strong>: Book a treatment at the hotel spa, the only amenity I wasn't able to experience due to my own lack of forward planning.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1f2225aee6a822c9029ff4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hotel Reviews Banner COVID 19 policies\" height=\"418\" width=\"3335\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>As noted, I felt the hotel did a good job of addressing health concerns and enforcing new policies. Here's what else they include:</p><h3>Front Desk and Lobby</h3><ul><li>The front desk will have plexiglas shields in place and staff and guests will be required to wear face masks.&#160;Masks will be available for guests upon request.</li><li>Increased cleaning frequency of the lobby area with a dedicated attendant sanitizing per shift and&#160;follow CDC recommended procedures and frequency.</li><li>Hand sanitizer will be provided and visible.</li></ul><h3>Valet</h3><ul><li>Valet attendants and managers will be required to wear face masks.</li><li>The valet team will be provided with sanitizing wipes to sanitize car keys. Car interior surfaces that must be touched will be wiped clean before returning to guests, including door handles, gear shifts, steering wheels, and any other surfaces touched by valet. Alternatively, guests may also be provided with sanitizing wipe to clean the car.</li></ul><h3>Housekeeping</h3><ul><li>Housekeeping personnel will be required to wear face masks.</li><li>Rooms will be cleaned and sanitized for guests arrival and again upon departure.</li><li>Rooms will be vacated for 48 hours prior to the next guest being able to check-in to a room.</li><li>Housekeeping will not enter an occupied room unless specifically requested by the guest.</li><li>All unnecessary items, such as paper products, pen, pad, etc., will be removed from guestrooms.</li><li>A new in-room amenity will be provided: 1.25ML Hand Sanitizer.</li></ul><h3>Food &#38; Beverage Outlets</h3><ul><li>The <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60864-d529464-Reviews-Carousel_Piano_Bar_Lounge-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Carousel Bar and Lounge</a> is open daily in the lounge area only from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. with a cocktail and bar bite menu.</li><li>Food and alcoholic beverages will be available to order at <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60864-d3247195-Reviews-Criollo_Restaurant-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Criollo Restaurant</a>.</li><li>All guests, serving personnel, hostess, bartenders, cocktail waitresses, bussers and managers will be required to wear face masks.</li><li>Increased cleaning frequency of the bar areas with one dedicated staff member sanitizing per shift.</li><li>Hand sanitizer stations will be placed at the entrance of <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60864-d3247195-Reviews-Criollo_Restaurant-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Criollo Restaurant</a> for guests to use before entering the restaurant.</li><li>Criollo's new seating capacity is based on current government protocol.</li><li>Signage will be placed at the entrance to assist guests with social distancing.</li><li>Room service will not be offered at this time.</li></ul>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e27582662fa8110bc34a994?format=jpeg\" alt=\"7 Hotel Reviews Banner Bottom Line\" height=\"151\" width=\"1201\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Checking into Hotel Monteleone was my first stay in a New Orleans Hotel since March.</p><p>And given the fact that New Orleans is normally such a freewheeling town, I was anxious that some of the city and hotel character might have been lost due to the new safety regulations. However, the Monteleone struck a good balance of taking a sensible approach, while managing to keep most of its amenities open. Being able to go to the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60864-d2194904-Reviews-Carousel_Bar-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Carousel Bar</a> and eat breakfast on-site, and safely, are a big draw right now.</p><p>During regular times, the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Hotel Monteleone</a> is one of the more expensive luxury hotels in the city, thanks to its historic status, amenities, and location. To see a room rate well under $200 is a rarity, and if you're comfortable with travel, now presents an optimal time to take advantage of lower rates and occupancy.</p><p>The occupancy rate during my stay seemed quite low, going off what I was able to see, with not many guests checking in or out and no crowds in the public spaces, and so social distancing wasn't an issue. I used the pool and the restaurant without any qualms at all, and the experience was generally very good.</p><p>Booking during COVID-19 gives guests some extra value for money. If you can find a rate close to my $151 per night, then the Hotel Monteleone is a good choice, and offers an opportunity to stay in a genuinely historic property and one of the few family-run hotels of its kind in the country.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fmonteleone.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book a room at The Hotel Monteleone starting at $151 per night</a></h2>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a db94fce90018f7b802?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f7cda31282c500018c78fce?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn7@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-25-000_3304cbc0bec770e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7cda96282c500018c78fd6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-27-398_b296c7de2cc341e5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d97928ad831b2140609a1c0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-35-619_d80e0d95babc043d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d97929ab15102103d15bdb7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn23@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-31-675_9ff3acd9ca11b57b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d9792adb15102134748b70c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn76@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-29-747_bb4a21116ddd2e2e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f1f2225aee6a822c9029ff4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn28@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-27-279_cb78cee8dd138e51.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e27582662fa8110bc34a994?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn25@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-29-519_507fe28280279830.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cv7Cjf4yg9Y:EFAuzeAHwKA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn38@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-34-445_7bfbbf5fc1c83e80.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cv7Cjf4yg9Y:EFAuzeAHwKA:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cv7Cjf4yg9Y:EFAuzeAHwKA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn68@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-34-806_01bd25f11ece7750.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/cv7Cjf4yg9Y":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn17@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-29-461_03293ad951334420.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360907},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"The Trump campaign accused Michigan's governor of having 'hatred in her heart' just hours after the FBI said it foiled an extremist plot to kidnap her","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-said-michigan-governor-has-hatred-in-her-heart-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f77b6ea74820019ca60e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jason Miller\" height=\"1124\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trump campaign advisor Jason Miller on Thursday.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Twitter</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Jason Miller, a senior advisor for the Trump campaign, on Thursday attacked Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer just hours after the FBI said it had stopped armed right-wing extremists who were plotting to kidnap her.</li>\n<li>Miller went after Whitmer for suggesting President Donald Trump was \"complicit\" in extremist violence because of his hateful rhetoric and refusal to condemn white-supremacist groups.</li>\n<li>\"If we want to talk about hatred, then Gov. Whitmer, go look in the mirror &#8212; the fact that she wakes up every day with such hatred in her heart for President Trump,\" Miller said in a Fox News appearance.</li>\n<li>Earlier in the day, federal prosecutors charged six men with plotting to kidnap Whitmer and overthrow Michigan's government.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Jason Miller, a senior advisor for President Donald Trump's 2020 reelection campaign, accused Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of having \"hatred in her heart\" the same day the FBI said it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-foiled-right-wing-militia-plot-kidnap-michigan-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">foiled a right-wing extremist plot to kidnap her</a>.</p><p>The Michigan governor was critical of the president during a Thursday news conference in which she addressed the plot. Miller attacked Whitmer during a Fox News appearance soon afterward.</p><p>\"These are some pretty shameful comments here from Gov. Whitmer because how you can go from a moment of unity to attacking President Trump, I thought was just completely ridiculous,\" Miller said.</p><p>He added: \"If we want to talk about hatred, then Gov. Whitmer, go look in the mirror — the fact that she wakes up every day with such hatred in her heart for President Trump.\"&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Aaron Rupar  (@atrupar) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1314282762271158275?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 8, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>During her press conference, Whitmer said Trump was \"complicit\" in extremist violence in the US.&#160;</p><p>The Michigan Democrat said Trump has been \"fomenting anger and giving comfort to those who spread fear, hatred, and division.\"</p><p>\"When our leaders meet with, encourage, or fraternize with domestic terrorists, they legitimize their actions and they were complicit,\" Whitmer added. \"When they contribute to hate speech, they're complicit.\"</p><p>Whitmer cited the fact that Trump declined an opportunity to explicitly condemn white-supremacist groups during the first presidential debate last week. He instead opted to publicly boost the far-right extremist group known as the Proud Boys.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;NowThis  (@nowthisnews) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1314281572573556737?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 8, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The president has a long record of being endorsed by white-supremacist groups and other far-right extremists, and they've often looked to him as a source of encouragement. Trump in some instances has condemned white-supremacist groups, but typically after significant pressure from the public and lawmakers in Washington, DC.</p><p>After <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stand-by-trump-hesitates-to-condemn-white-supremacists-in-debate-2020-9\">Trump told the Proud Boys</a> to \"stand back and stand by,\" South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott, the only Black Republican in the Senate, urged Trump to \"correct\" his remarks.</p><p>In late April, armed protesters <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-lockdown-protesters-brought-rifles-into-the-state-capitol-2020-4\">descended upon Michigan's capital</a> to demonstrate opposition to Whitmer's extension of the state's stay-at-home order. Earlier in the month, Trump had tweeted: \"LIBERATE MICHIGAN.\" Trump called the armed demonstrators \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-protestors-with-guns-in-michigan-capitol-are-very-good-people-2020-5\">very good people</a>.\"</p><p>\"These are very good people, but they are angry. They want their lives back again, safely! See them, talk to them, make a deal,\" Trump said in <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1256202305680158720?s=20\">a May 1 tweet</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f7957ea74820019ca60f4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Michigan militia .JPG\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A militia group with no political affiliation and not related to the plot stands in front of the governor&#39;s office on April 30 in Lansing, Michigan.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Seth Herald</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Federal prosecutors have charged six men with plotting to kidnap Whitmer and overthrow Michigan's government.</p><p>The men were identified in court documents as Adam Fox, Barry Croft, Ty Garbin, Kaleb Franks, Daniel Harris, and Brandon Caserta.</p><p>The FBI said the men contacted members of an armed right-wing militia in Michigan to orchestrate the plot.</p><p>\"In early 2020, the FBI became aware through social media that a group of individuals were discussing the violent overthrow of certain government and law-enforcement components,\" Richard Trask, an FBI agent, wrote in an affidavit.</p><p>\"Several members talked about murdering 'tyrants' or 'taking' a sitting governor,\" Trask added. \"The group decided they needed to increase their numbers and encouraged each other to talk to their neighbors and spread their message.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"The best Airbnbs in California","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-airbnbs-california","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eea5e55988ee33cee53fc11?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best california airbnbs\" height=\"922\" width=\"1444\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>As Americans slowly get back to domestic travel, many are looking for destinations within 200 miles from home <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/popular-airbnb-trending-destinations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">according to recent Airbnb data</a>.</strong></li><li><strong>Private home rentals are a top lodging choice since <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">they limit encounters with others and promote social distancing</a>. </strong></li><li><strong>California is one of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/popular-airbnb-trending-destinations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the most popular locations for Airbnb rentals</a>, with</strong><strong> spectacular homes near beaches, deserts, wine country, national parks, and urban centers.</strong></li><li><strong>We combed Airbnb listings to select top-reviewed homes with impeccable amenities in cities such as San Diego, Los Angeles, Palm Springs, San Francisco, and others.</strong></li></ul><p>As people begin to return to domestic travel, safety tops many Americans' priority lists, with travelers choosing close-to-home driving trips bound for private home rentals as opposed to boarding a flight to a crowded resort.</p><p>That's because <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">doctors consider the private residential environment to be low risk</a> for virus transmission, given the fact that the virus is known to transmit primarily between people via respiratory droplets. And when compared with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-hotels-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hotels</a>, the number of face-to-face encounters at a private home rental is especially low.</p><p>Airbnb also recently released data underscoring these travel trends. They showed <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/popular-airbnb-trending-destinations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">nearly half of 2,200 adult survey respondents in the US</a> prefer their first post-pandemic trip to be within 200 miles from home.</p><p>However, before you jump into making any travel plans, it's vital to know and consider that without a vaccine there's no guarantee of safety right now. We always recommend following guidelines from the CDC and WHO and taking safety precautions like hand washing and social distancing.</p><p>Additionally, many parts of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hot-dry-conditions-stoke-devastating-california-wildfires-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">California are experiencing extreme wildfires</a> and even places not directly affected by the fires are experiencing low air quality. You can check the daily wildfire update <a href=\"https://www.fire.ca.gov/daily-wildfire-report/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><p>But, for some added peace of mind, Airbnb recently announced they are requiring all <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hosts to follow stringent new cleaning policies</a>. This includes wearing a mask, practicing social distancing, and, for hosts and their teams, abiding by a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.airbnb.com/resources/hosting-homes/a/airbnbs-5-step-cleaning-process-explained-187\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-ml-dynamic=\"true\" data-ml-dynamic-type=\"sl\" data-orig-url=\"https://www.airbnb.com/resources/hosting-homes/a/airbnbs-5-step-cleaning-process-explained-187\" data-ml-id=\"5\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1602190412068ace\" data-skimlinks-tracking=\"xid:fr1602190412068ace\" data-uri=\"414b4056421c8f86cf3a364e723471b4\">five-step enhanced cleaning process</a>. Still, some travelers may feel more comfortable taking added precautions like bringing their own sheets and running dishes through the dishwasher before use. Of course, that means you're now cleaning the home for which you likely already paid a hefty cleaning fee.</p><p>With that in mind, if you are planning a future trip to the Golden State, there's plenty of accommodation choices, including beach bungalows, mid-century desert homes, and tiny mountain houses. We rounded up top-rated Airbnbs in cities such as San Diego, Los Angeles, and San Francisco; as well as coastal getaways in Santa Barbara and Big Sur, wine country retreats in Napa Valley and San Louis Obispo, desert homes in Palm Springs and Joshua Tree, and listings near national parks like Yosemite.</p><p>The following properties were all selected based on the following criteria:</p><ol><li><strong>Airbnb listing is for the entire home (no awkward hallway encounters).</strong></li><li><strong>All are highly-rated, well-located Airbnb listings with a rating as close to 5.0 as possible.</strong></li><li><strong>All homes are listed by Superhosts to ensure a positive experience, with exceptional design, charm, and amenities to guarantee a great getaway.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Homes offer an affordable price range, starting at $93 for a Yosemite tiny home and rising to $425 for a Big Sur splurge.</strong></li></ol><h2>Looking for more It has a comfy Queen-sized bed, a big living room with sleeper sofa, fireplace and kitchenette, private guest's laundry room, and even a bathroom with steam.&#160;</p><p>The home is located on the bottom floor of the host's tri-level home with a separate entrance at the side yard, but it feels quite private. A seasonal creek surrounds the large wraparound wooden deck, fully ensconcing you in nature, and the home offers easy access to great nearby hiking trails, and beautiful Butterfly Beach is a five-minute drive away.</p><p>This listing has plenty of availability throughout October and November.</p><p><strong>Rating:</strong> 4.93</p><p><strong>COVID-19 cleaning procedures:</strong> This home participates in Airbnb's&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"18a34ac984b0eaae3b22940000d05d74\">Enhanced Clean program</a>, meaning the host is committed to a rigorous cleaning protocol developed with leading health and hospitality experts.</p>\n\tFarmhouse cottage in Napa Valley, $221\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eea57bf4dca6812b72b2a03?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen_Shot_2020 06 15_at_11.37.11_AM\" height=\"924\" width=\"1232\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F2302352%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1592416124_ScpN%252F8TlZa0dgx29%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this farmhouse cottage starting at $221 per night</a></h2><p>The challenges of recent months have undoubtedly created a slew of new wine devotees, joining the ranks of those who've long loved to visit wine country for winery tours and barrel tastings.</p><p>Book your wine country stay in this fully renovated farmhouse cottage located in a tranquil neighborhood on Main Street, just a mile from the downtown area. The sweet 600-square-foot space has two Queen-sized beds, a couch, and a kitchenette. This home is best for a couple or friend getaway as children under 12 are not permitted.</p><p>Here, the amount of interaction is up to the guest &#8212; a key concern in the pandemic age. Hosts can make themselves available to talk about restaurants and wineries &#8230; or make themselves as scarce as you prefer, leaving you to enjoy a glass of wine on the patio after a day out touring the vineyards.</p><p>This property still has many available dates in October and is almost entirely open in November.&#160;</p><p><strong>Rating:</strong> 4.92</p><p><strong>COVID-19 cleaning procedures:</strong> This home participates in Airbnb's&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"18a34ac984b0eaae3b22940000d05d74\">Enhanced Clean program</a>, meaning the host is committed to a rigorous cleaning protocol developed with leading health and hospitality experts.</p>\n\tMidcentury home in Palm Springs, $284\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eea5f5faee6a87e11295e23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen_Shot_2020 06 16_at_9.16.38_AM\" height=\"923\" width=\"1231\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F5249512%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1592418036_RiDdC45BruhJvCHq%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this private mid-century getaway starting at $284 per night</a></h2><p>Palm Springs is an easy road trip from Los Angeles &#8212; just about 100 miles from Downtown. And for the full Palm Springs getaway experience, you're going to want to rent a home in the vibrant midcentury modern style for which the town is famous.</p><p>This two-bedroom, two-bathroom home is in the desirable Ruth Hardy Park/Movie Colony East neighborhood, with views of the dramatic San Jacinto mountains, with&#160;room for four adults. An additional two children can fit in the foldout sofa in the living room.</p><p>The entertainment setup includes Netflix, Hulu, and other streaming channels. But you'll probably spend most of your time here outdoors in the sleek saltwater pool, spa, and lounging area.&#160;</p><p>The property is mostly booked for the next few months, but availability is subject to change.</p><p><strong>Rating:</strong> 4.93</p><p><strong>COVID-19 cleaning procedures:</strong> This home doesn't list any specific new policies, but the hosts have a 4.9 rating for cleanliness.</p>\n\tScenic mountain home near Big Sur, $425\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eea56fb3f737022525cb5e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen_Shot_2020 06 15_at_11.06.47_AM\" height=\"956\" width=\"1275\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F12606638%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1592415561_OSgqwk8fWoIl9u1i%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book this sunny mountain home with views starting at $425 per night</a></h2><p>The coastline around Big Sur is the stuff of screen savers, and the cliffs make for an awe-inspiring if harrowing road trip. Here, it's all about the stunning views and the raw natural environment &#8212; this rental lets you take savor both in serenity and privacy. View tons of stars at night, hear the birds sing, and watch the red-tailed hawks circling above.</p><p>Arrive via a private paved and gated driveway to this home with a full 365-degree view of redwoods and oak ridges; it enjoys full sun all day long. The listing is just right for a solo traveler or a couple with two bedrooms, each with a Queen-sized bed. There are also lawn chairs, an outdoor fireplace, and a distinctly indoor-outdoor vibe.</p><p>This property still has a few scattered days open in November with more dates open in December.</p><p><strong>Rating:</strong> 4.95</p><p><strong>COVID-19 cleaning procedures:</strong> No specific cleaning procedures are noted yet, but the property is newly renovated, and it holds a 4.9 cleanliness score across 151 reviews.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-airbnbs-california'>Business 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Microsoft told employees it plans to release a browser-based app for the Xbox Game Pass streaming service next year that will get around Apple App Store rules: 'We absolutely will end up on iOS'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-xbox-game-pass-apple-iphone-ipad-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f68c8c8323fc4001e0d7780?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Phil Spencer\" height=\"2246\" width=\"2995\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Phil Spencer, head of Microsoft&#39;s gaming division.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kevork Djansezian/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>Microsoft last month officially added a key feature to Game Pass, its Netflix-style subscription library of Xbox games: The ability to stream many of the included games to any Android smartphone or tablet.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Notably, Apple's iPhone and iPad were absent from the launch. </strong><strong>Apple has said it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-explains-why-xbox-game-pass-is-not-on-iphone-2020-8\">doesn't allow apps for streaming services such as Game Pass or Google's Stadia</a> because it's unable to review each game on the platform.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>\"We absolutely will end up on iOS with Game Pass,\" Microsoft gaming boss Phil Spencer told employees. </strong><strong>The company is targeting 2021 for the potential release of a \"direct browser-based solution,\" Spencer said.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Amazon says that it's able to <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/25/21455343/amazon-luna-apple-app-store-rules-cloud-gaming-streaming-google-nvidia\">bring its forthcoming cloud gaming service Luna to iPhone</a> by offering it as a web app.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Microsoft did not comment at the time of publication.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>A</strong><strong>re you a Microsoft employee? Contact this reporter via the encrypted messaging app Signal (+1-425-344-</strong><strong>8242) or email (astewart@businessinsider.com).</strong></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"f0e80ded5d35b2778c5da3bdda2e6898\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Microsoft's gaming boss Phil Spencer told employees at an all-hands meeting on Wednesday the company is planning to bring Game Pass to Apple's iPhone and iPad, targeting 2021 for the potential release of a \"direct browser-based solution,\" Business Insider has learned.</p><p>\"We absolutely will end up on iOS,\" Spencer told employees, according to two people with direct knowledge of his comments. Microsoft did not comment at the time of publication. Apple has not yet responded to a request for comment.</p><p>Microsoft last month added a key new feature to Game Pass, its Netflix-style subscription service that gives Xbox and PC gamers access to a vast catalogue of games. Now, Game Pass subscribers can stream many of the included titles directly to their Android phones or tablets, no console required.&#160;</p><p>Notable by its absence at the feature's launch was support for Apple's iPhone and iPad. An Apple spokesperson told Business Insider this summer that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-explains-why-xbox-game-pass-is-not-on-iphone-2020-8\">doesn't allow for game streaming in apps like Game Pass</a> or Google's Stadia because it is unable to review each game in the services' respective libraries.&#160;</p><p>Spencer, who <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4887tnMhkfE&#38;feature=youtu.beu.be\">has said publicly he's determined to offer Game Pass to Apple users</a>, told employees the company is exploring getting to iPhone and iPad devices through their browsers.</p><p>Later on Thursday, <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/8/21508706/microsoft-xcloud-ios-web-browser-2021\">the Verge reported that at the same meeting</a>, Spencer said that streaming with Game Pass would come to Windows 10 PCs next year as well.</p><p>A hint as to what that might look like comes from Amazon, which says that it's able to <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/25/21455343/amazon-luna-apple-app-store-rules-cloud-gaming-streaming-google-nvidia\">bring its forthcoming cloud gaming service Luna to iPhone</a> by offering it as a web app. In an interview with Engadget, <a href=\"https://www.engadget.com/luna-amazon-cloud-gaming-interview-pwa-apple-173948922.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhldmVyZ2UuY29tLw&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAFSswkpXjwXbCzl0m9fP5xe2H0eTyV_oTeo6bGxyLNX_4abpReIPNcR1PrCI4dPILSAIfyw8SpI800LRL78mw0EgWRQuJh5ILJiBLAyg5jjOhiuZKFhqZLYq7PIMuUpf_e-Pn_EEYPeWRXh6DDB-vZG2kGoijwDeWvSEpg_iTDo0pg_iTDo0\">Luna engineering and technology head George Tsipolitis</a> said that Amazon worked with Apple to make that functionality possible. Google, meanwhile, makes its similar Stadia service available on PCs and Macs via its Chrome web browser, though it too is not available on iPhone or iPad.</p><p>Apple indicated that Game Pass or Stadia would be allowed to offer game streaming services, only if each individual title in the catalog were available in its own discrete app.</p><p>Microsoft indicated that this approach would be a non-starter for Game Pass, which has dozens of games available: \"Unfortunately, we do not have a path to bring our vision of cloud gaming with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate to gamers on iOS via the Apple App Store,\" a Microsoft spokesperson said in August.</p><p>Apple's decision not to allow services similar to Game Pass on iOS became a topic during the Congressional antitrust subcommittee's investigation into potentially anticompetitive practices by Big Tech companies including Apple.</p><p>Former Apple App Store director Phil Shoemaker, according to a report the subcommittee released this week, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-arcade-xbox-stadia-blocked-gaming-services-iphone-app-store-2020-10\">claimed Apple doesn't allow services like Game Pass because they compete directly</a> with the Apple's own subscription service, Apple Arcade.</p><p>Apple this week announced an event planned for Oct. 13, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-iphone-12-release-date-announced-october-event-2020-10\">where it is expected to unveil its next iPhone</a>.</p><p><em><strong>Got a tip?</strong>&#160;Contact reporter Ashley Stewart via encrypted messaging app Signal (+1-425-344-8242) or email (astewart@businessinsider.com).</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"How Trump could lose and still keep Biden from cutting a deal with Iran","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-could-lose-still-keep-biden-from-deal-with-iran-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f73e37874fe5b0018a8e235?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump Biden Debate\" height=\"2012\" width=\"4024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden at the presidential debate in Cleveland, September 29, 2020, .\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/president-donald-trump-and-former-vice-president-and-news-photo/1228795234?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Morry Gash-Pool/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Former Vice President Joe Biden has said he'd be open to quickly re-entering the Iran nuclear deal if Iran returns to full compliance.</li>\n<li>But legal hurdles and potential Congressional backlash from Republicans would impede Biden's ability to quickly reverse some of the Trump administration's additional sanctions.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><strong>US presidential candidate Joe Biden has expressed he'd be open to quickly re-entering the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) if Iran returns to full compliance. </strong></p><p><strong>But his predecessor's hardline policies would probably necessitate expanding the scope of negotiations with Tehran beyond the current deal, leading Iran to adopt <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/iran-goes-all-game-nuclear-chicken-trump-irgc\">an even harder position on its nuclear program</a>.</strong></p><ul><li>Biden criticized the Trump administration's hawkish Iran policy and&#160;<a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/us-withdraws-from-iran-nuclear-deal-trump-what-next-washington-tehran\">2018 withdrawal from the nuclear deal</a> in a September 13 opinion piece, in which he wrote that returning to the JCPOA could be the start of broader diplomacy between Tehran and Washington.&#160;</li></ul><p><strong>Simply re-entering the JCPOA would be difficult for both Washington and Tehran, as the current US sanctions architecture is now far more complex than it was when the deal was signed in 2015.</strong>&#160;</p><p>Under its \"maximum pressure\" campaign, the Trump administration has aggressively expanded the scope of sanctions in recent years and will continue to do so for as long as it remains in office. According to a September 29 report by Bloomberg, the White House is considering designating Iran's entire financial system subject to sanctions under Executive Order 13902.</p><p>Such a move would effectively blacklist foreign companies from doing business with not only Iranian banks (which are already heavily sanctioned), but all Iranian financial actors, including the networks used for remittances and Iran's hawala system. The overall impact on the Iranian economy, however, would be limited given the already expansive nature of current US sanctions on Iran's banking sector and exports (which are mostly humanitarian and food shipments).</p><ul><li>In April 2019, the United States designated Iran's entire Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a foreign terrorist organization under Section 219 of the Immigration and Nationality Act.</li><li>In September 2019, the US Treasury Department sanctioned Iran's central bank and sovereign wealth fund under Executive Order 13224 for providing material support to Hezbollah and the IRGC's Quds Force, both of which are designated as terrorist organizations under the same executive order. &#160;</li><li>In October 2019, the Treasury Department's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) issued a final rule determining that Iran was a jurisdiction of primary money-laundering concern under Section 311 of the US Patriot Act.</li></ul><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5665cc6784307618008b7fa4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tehran Iran bazar\" height=\"2333\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A man shops at a store in a bazaar in Tehran, Iran.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://pictures.reuters.com/C.aspx?VP3=SearchResult&#38;VBID=2C0BXZZQLALAL&#38;SMLS=1&#38;RW=1309&#38;RH=850#/SearchResult&#38;VBID=2C0BXZZQLALAL&#38;SMLS=1&#38;RW=1309&#38;RH=850&#38;POPUPPN=8&#38;POPUPIID=2C04080D3300E\" target=\"_blank\">Reuters/Raheb Homavandi</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Iran would demand the reversal of all US sanctions implemented by the Trump administration, including those not specifically included in the JCPOA, <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/iran-inching-away-nuclear-deal-what-happens-now-jcpoa-united-states-sanctions-eu\">before returning to full compliance</a>.&#160;</strong></p><p>Even if a future Biden administration lifts sanctions targeting Iran's oil exports, Tehran will want to see Washington's terrorism and money laundering designations of its financial system reversed. After the JCPOA was implemented, Iran still struggled to attract foreign investment in part because of investor hesitance. As long these US designations and subsequent sanctions remain in place, international financial institutions and other foreign investors will continue to avoid doing business with Iran, thus robbing Tehran of the expected financial benefits under the JCPOA.</p><p><strong>Negotiating With Iran: Then And Now</strong></p><p>The administration of former US President Barack Obama pragmatically separated Iran's missile program and its regional proxy strategy from its nuclear enrichment program. This enabled the White House <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/history-iran-nuclear-deal\">to reach a deal that addressed its primary concern</a>&#160;— Iran's potential acquisition of a nuclear weapon — in exchange for suspending its most powerful form of leverage, financial sanctions.</p><p>Since then, however, Iran has shown that it is willing to use its missile and drone capabilities to strike commercial targets in Saudi Arabia, which will make it harder for the United States to reach another comprehensive deal with Iran that does not at least partially address its allies' growing concerns with Iran's missile program. That said, Iran's nuclear enrichment program is not nearly as far along as it was five years ago, meaning the United States may now have more room to hold out on demanding concessions beyond Iran's nuclear program itself.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5669f6c872f2c10f0f8b4bbc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tehran Bazaar\" height=\"2492\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People walk through an alley where most shops are closed, in Tehran&#39;s main bazaar, October 13, 2008.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters/Caren Firouz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Legal hurdles and potential Congressional backlash from Republicans would impede Biden's ability to quickly reverse some of the Trump administration's additional sanctions.</strong>&#160;</p><p>Lifting the Section 311 designation, in particular — which has effectively made the Iranian financial system toxic for foreign investment — would be Tehran's top priority. But in order to remove this designation, a future Biden administration would have to first prove that Iran had sufficiently addressed the money laundering and terrorism financing concerns voiced by both the US government and the Financial Action Task Force (FATF).&#160;</p><ul><li>Republicans are unlikely to have the support in Congress to implement legislation that would constrain a Democratic White House from reaching a quick deal with Iran. But their oversight and scrutiny would likely complicate any attempt to remove the current sanctions on Iran's central bank and/or the IRGC.</li><li>In 2016, Iran launched an action plan with the FATF to address the organization's concerns with money laundering and terrorism financing. But the Trump administration's withdrawal from the JCPOA thwarted Iran's ability to make political progress on the plan, which eventually prompted the FATF to reintroduce countermeasures on Tehran in February.&#160;</li><li>The recent election of a more conservative Iranian parliament has also made the passage of legislation needed to address international concerns with Iran's financial system even less likely.</li></ul><p><strong>Any US-Iran deal reached before mid-2022 would probably be narrow in scope, with both sides making some commitments to return to the JCPOA and engage in comprehensive over an extended period of time. </strong></p><p>Such a deal could see Iran agreeing to forgo further stockpiling of enriched uranium and/or reversing expansion plans on centrifuge R&#38;D. A narrow agreement could also see Tehran reducing the number of advanced centrifuges being installed in exchange for modest sanctions relief, which could entail resuming waivers for a specific volume of Iranian oil exports, suspending sanctions related to other Iranian exports and/or full US support for humanitarian-related trade channels.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4f7ac655f6001969f01d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"iran deal jcpoa sunset provisions\" height=\"2433\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/limits-biden-s-proposed-return-diplomacy-iran\" target=\"_blank\">Straftfor</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>A prolonged negotiation period would force the United States to discuss issues with Iran beyond just the current terms of the JCPOA, as many of the deal's sunset provisions expire in 2023 and 2025.&#160;</strong></p><p>Under the JCPOA's original timeline, the United States would have only been okay with sunset provisions that allow for Iran to restart some nuclear activity and the removal of UN sanctions on Iran's ballistic missile program if its relationship with Tehran during the following decade drastically improved.</p><p>But Trump's hardline sanctions strategy in recent years has made such an improvement in US-Iran relations all but impossible. Washington would likely also demand that any successor agreement to the JCPOA extends the timeline for sunset clauses that expire in 2023 and 2025 and includes Iranian concessions on its missile program, which Iran has actively used in regional conflicts over the last three years.&#160;</p><p><strong>Such an expansion of negotiations would prompt Iran to adopt a more hardline position with its nuclear program in order to keep Washington focused on Tehran's primary concern of sanctions relief.&#160;</strong></p><p>Iran's nuclear program&#160;<a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/iran-may-be-weak-its-strategy-working-us-trump-sanctions-nuclear-jcpoa\">remains its most valuable negotiation tool against the United States</a>. Tehran will thus want to maintain the most critical aspects of the program, such as the right to enrich uranium and holding on to current stockpiles and centrifuges, until the United States agrees to suspend or remove the vast majority of its economic sanctions on Iran.</p><p>Otherwise, Iran would have to offer more significant concessions on its missile program and regional strategy, which are more important to Iran's overall defense strategy, in order to receive significant sanctions relief. Iran hopes to use its nuclear program as a way to narrow any expansion of talks with the United States beyond it. &#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-could-lose-still-keep-biden-from-deal-with-iran-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
