11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"The best wine subscriptions","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Online wine clubs deliver cases of wine right to your door, and they help you learn more about wine and develop your palate.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>The best online wine subscriptions offer user-friendly ordering experiences, safe and reliable shipping, well-curated selections, and resources to make you a more informed wine drinker.</strong></li><li><a href=\"https://winc.mivh.net/c/196318/578512/9573?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Winc</strong></a><strong> is the best online wine subscription we've tried over the years because it offers all of the above, and it's always in tune with the latest wine trends.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-glass\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>The best wine glasses</strong></a></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals.</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>This content is intended for readers 21+. Please drink responsibly. If you or anyone you know is dealing with alcohol abuse, get help.&#160;The&#160;</em><a href=\"https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><em>Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration's National Helpline</em></a><em> at 1-800-662-HELP (4357)&#160;provides&#160;a free, confidential, 24/7, treatment referral, and information service.</em></p><p>To an outsider, the world of wine —&#160;with all its varietals, regions, tasting techniques, and pairing rules —&#160;can seem intimidating and difficult to navigate. Online wine clubs, however, aim to bring these barriers crashing down and make the process so easy you don't even need to leave your house.&#160;</p><p>These wine clubs are typically subscription-based and send you monthly or quarterly shipments of wine that fit your existing tastes while helping you expand your horizons and discover new favorites.&#160;</p><p>\"No one is born with a great palate,\" said Vanessa Price, a sommelier, wine writer for New York Magazine, and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1419744917/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051519_best-wine-club-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=1419744917&linkId=5dd423dc26b6af9fc598456111bb56c826b6af9fc598456111bb56c8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Big Macs &#38; Burgundy: Wine Pairings for the Real World,</a>&#160;\"they develop it over time. The more you expand your experiences with different types of wine, the more evolved your palate will become.\"&#160;</p><p>Online wine subscriptions can fast-track that evolution if you don't necessarily have the time or energy to do <em>all</em> the work.&#160;</p><p>\"Generally, wine clubs are great for those who want to be introduced to new things, but who may not be confident enough yet to select new things for themselves,\" said David Hamburger, director of special events at <a href=\"https://www.ackerwines.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Acker</a>, the oldest wine shop in America. \"A good wine club should be somewhat instructive, sharing with members enough information about each wine to provide background, but also allow members the flexibility to enjoy it their own way — with a recipe, or food pairing suggestions.\" And if you need extra guidance on how to taste or store your wine, head over to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club#wine-faqs-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">our FAQs here</a>.</p><p>In our tests of some of the most popular online wine subscriptions, we found that safe and reliable shipping standards, subscription flexibility and customization, and unique, high-quality offerings are also important factors to keep in mind.&#160;</p><p>With every service below, our bottles arrived on time and securely packaged. Member experience was also great across the board. You can easily skip shipments or cancel your subscription directly from your online account.&#160;</p><p>Remember, an adult 21+ years old must be present to sign for the wine shipment.&#160;</p><h2>Here are the best wine subscriptions:&#160;</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Best wine subscription overall: <a href=\"https://winc.mivh.net/c/196318/578512/9573?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored\">Winc</a></li><li>Best for sampling: <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&u=1088116&m=66986&urllink=www.getvinebox.com%2Fproducts%2Fq3-2020ts%2Fq3-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vinebox</a></li><li>Best for natural and organic wine: <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&u=1088116&m=32643&urllink=www.plonkwineclub.com%2Fcollections%2Fall-wine-clubsl-wine-clubs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Plonk</a></li><li>Best for value: <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Firstleaf</a></li><li>Best curation: <a href=\"https://parcellewine.com/products/parcelle-wine-drop\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Parcelle Wine Drop</a></li></ul><p><em>Prices and details are accurate as of 10/8/20. We've overhauled this guide by re-testing previous picks to see if they still stack up, trying new wine subscriptions, and speaking to experts within the wine space. We're continuing to test other subscription services, including those specializing in sparkling wine.&#160;</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best subscription overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f427d282c500018c79657?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Winc\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The modern wine club model is nearly perfect in <a href=\"https://winc.mivh.net/c/196318/578512/9573?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Winc</a>'s hands, from its large and on-trend bottle variety to its streamlined browsing and customer rating system.</h3><p><strong>Subscription frequency: </strong>Every month</p><p><strong>Shipping fee: </strong>$9 for orders of three bottles or fewer; free for orders of four bottles or more</p><p><strong>A la carte shop: </strong>Yes</p><p>As a new member at Winc, you start by taking a quick quiz that asks about your tastes and preferences. Then you're matched up with wines that align with your \"Palate Profile,\" and from there you can create your own cart of wine selections. In addition to the suggestions presented to you, you can browse by category. The shop features clear ratings from other members and easy-to-digest descriptions of each wine.</p><p>This design provides a good balance of guidance and personalization &#8212; you get suggestions but you also have the freedom to pick out other wines that catch your eye.&#160;</p><p>Winc works directly with vineyards and makes all the wines it sells, producing over 664 wines from 78 grape varieties and 97 regions across 12 different countries since launch. You may see some of these wines also sold at Whole Foods, Vons, and Kroger stores. Since Winc uses subscriber data and ratings to inform new wine production, most of the wine you see will line right up with emerging trends.&#160;</p><p>On the downside, this rapid production model means it can be difficult to re-purchase some of your favorites, so it's best not to get too attached to a particular bottle.&#160;</p><p>I've tried Winc a few times over the last couple of years and always found something I liked while further developing my tastes and preferences. It's through Winc that I've grown to appreciate Chenin Blanc from South Africa and how I realized Touriga Nacional, a dry red wine popular in Portugal, is not so popular with my taste buds.&#160;</p><p>You can only see each wine's tasting notes and descriptions online, which is slightly inconvenient as you try out your monthly shipment. However, the online-first system ultimately works in your favor because you'll have your entire order history and personal notes all in one place to reference later.&#160;&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/winc-wine-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of Winc here.</a></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Wines are all based on consumer interests and trends, easy-to-navigate interface, many varietals</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Wine info and notes are only online, a la carte stock goes quickly</p>\n\tThe best subscription for sampling\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4567c655f6001969efd6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Vinebox\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=66986&#38;urllink=www.getvinebox.com%2Fproducts%2Fq3-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vinebox</a> packages European wines in sleek and distinctive single-serving glasses so you can try nine different kinds without committing to whole bottles.</h3><p><strong>Subscription frequency:</strong> Every 3 months&#160;</p><p><strong>Shipping fee:</strong> Free&#160;</p><p><strong>A la carte shop:</strong> Yes&#160;</p><p>It's easy to distinguish Vinebox from the pack: you get no less than nine wines, neatly packed into individual glass tubes and accompanied by a well-designed informational booklet, all stored in sturdy yet gift-worthy packaging.&#160;</p><p>Each quarter's box is pre-curated so you can't customize it to your tastes, but you'll have plenty of fun sipping and sampling each wine. The best part is that you won't feel bad opening and finishing a whole \"bottle\" because it's only a single serving. Vinebox's design is great for casual wine drinkers who hate commitment, plus it's convenient and practical because you don't even need a bottle opener or corkscrew to enjoy your drink.&#160;</p><p>If you do happen to fall in love with one of the samples, you can make use of the $15 credit given to you each quarter. This can be used towards a purchase of the full-sized version. You may also want to gift this unique and beautiful box to a friend whose wine preferences are eclectic or unclear &#8212; with so many varietals packed into every shipment, they're bound to enjoy at least one.</p><p>The particular box I received featured all light and medium-bodied wines, which I just so happen to enjoy. But it would've been even better to see some full-bodied wines represented, for additional variety and range.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/vinebox-wine-subscription-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of Vinebox here.</a></h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Good sampling size, memorable packaging, useful info cards</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Can't always find or buy the full bottle in the shop</p>\n\tThe best subscription for natural wine\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4878282c500018c7967f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Plonk\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>For natural, organic, and biodynamic wines, you can rely on <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=32643&#38;urllink=www.plonkwineclub.com%2Fcollections%2Fall-wine-clubs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Plonk</a> to take care of the expert vetting, thoughtful curation, and spot-on food pairing recommendations.</h3><p><strong>Subscription frequency:</strong> Every month</p><p><strong>Shipping fee: </strong>Free</p><p><strong>A la carte shop: </strong>Yes&#160;</p><p>Plonk, which is British derogatory slang for cheap, low-quality wine, provides wines that are anything but. The online club focuses exclusively on natural wines that are grown with organic, biodynamic, and sustainable vineyard practices, meaning they don't contain pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, or commercial additives (like colorants or artificial sugars). There's also an impressive selection of sulfite-free and unfiltered bottles.&#160;</p><p>If you're interested in the specific distinctions among the terms \"natural,\" \"organic,\" and \"biodynamic,\" founder Etty Klein breaks them down <a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/natural-vs-commercial-wine_b_1009052\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><p>Plonk prides itself on selecting and importing wines from small, boutique winemakers and lesser-known wine regions, flouting big industry names to give you a carefully vetted selection. While other online wine subscriptions may offer natural and sustainable options, few can boast both the convenience and range of Plonk's one-stop natural shop.&#160;</p><p>When you sign up, you have your choice of an all-red, all-white, or mixed variety box, with either four or 12 bottles per shipment. What the included informational printout lacks in glitzy presentation, at least compared to other services, it makes up for in precise tasting notes and ultra-specific food pairings courtesy of Food52. For example, one of my favorite Plonk discoveries, a 2019 Pinot Noir from Margaret River, Western Australia, should be enjoyed with stuffed peppers with lamb, orzo, and halloumi cheese.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Only natural wine offerings, pre-curated, easy to skip shipments or cancel your subscription&#160;</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Pricey, cannot be personalized</p>\n\tThe best subscription for value\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f49ecc655f6001969eff8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Firstleaf\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>You'll never have to pay more than $15 a bottle at <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Firstleaf</a>, where the quality and personalization are top-notch.</h3><p><strong>Subscription frequency: </strong>Every one, two, or three months&#160;</p><p><strong>Shipping fee: </strong>$9.95&#160;</p><p><strong>A la carte shop: </strong>Yes&#160;</p><p>Like Winc, Firstleaf has you start out with a quiz so it can better understand your preferences.&#160; When you're finished, it serves up six wines it thinks you'll like, and you can read about each one and decide whether you want to make any swaps. However, you only have six swaps per shipment. So, Firstleaf is that nice \"Goldilocks\" service where you have a bit of control, but you're still steered in the right direction.&#160;</p><p>To draw you in, Firstleaf has a very competitive introductory offer of $39.95 for six wines, including shipping. Afterward, the price goes up to $80, plus $9.95 shipping, but you're still only paying $15 for each bottle, many of which are industry award winners.</p><p>After you've tried every wine in your monthly shipment, you can rate them online. This step is important because Firstleaf will use your ratings to become smarter and hone in on an even better curation for you next month. As your wine knowledge and tastes evolve, so too will the service.&#160;</p><p>I've had the chance to try Firstleaf a few times in the last couple of years, and it's always been reliable. I appreciate that I don't have to do quite so much work in picking out the bottles and that the main effort only comes afterward, once I've tried everything.&#160;</p><p>On top of the existing value of the service, there's a strong referral program: if you share Firstleaf with a friend, they'll get $40 and you'll get $40.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/firstleaf-wine-club-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of Firstleaf here.</a>&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Flexibility to swap out pre-selected bottles in your order, attractive intro offer, good overall value</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>May take a few boxes/rounds of ratings for the system to understand more specific preferences</p>\n\tThe best subscription curation\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4b4cc655f6001969f002?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Parcelle\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://parcellewine.com/products/parcelle-wine-drop\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Parcelle Wine Drop</a> combines a truly unique selection of bottles with an informative yet unpretentious wine education from Michelin-starred sommeliers.</h3><p><strong>Subscription frequency: </strong>Every month</p><p><strong>Shipping fee: </strong>Free</p><p><strong>A la carte shop: </strong>Yes</p><p>I love Parcelle's Wine Drop because it has the feel of a cool and exclusive local club but it ships nationwide. Parcelle is based in New York City and enlists the curation and expertise of Michelin-starred sommeliers like the former wine directors of Eleven Madison Park and Chef's Table at Brooklyn Fare.&#160;</p><p>The experience indeed feels like you're asking for wine recs at a restaurant. It's arguably even better because your three wines also come with beautifully illustrated info cards and a copy of Parcelle Press, a mini journal that is, again, visually stunning.&#160;</p><p>Founder Grant Reynolds told Insider Reviews, \"The Wine Drop is our shortlist of our favorite wines to have around the house at that time of year. Nothing too fancy but always smart, a bit different, and from small producers focusing on making wines unique to the place they are from.\"</p><p>If you prefer more customization, you'll probably enjoy one of our other picks more, but if you want to leave it up to the pros, try Wine Drop. All three wines I received were hits, and they helped me realize a new love for orange wine.&#160;</p><p>Depending on the wine, the total cost of the individual bottles could come out to less than $95. The Wine Drop I received during September, for example, was $85. In other months, the total may be more. While fluctuating prices may be a dealbreaker for some, I found Wine Drop's tight curation and immersive experience to be compelling enough reasons to continue my subscription.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Pre-curated, unique variety, beautiful info cards, impressive expertise</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not personalized, could buy the bottles individually for less</p>\n\tWhat else we considered\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4bf9282c500018c79698?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Verve Wine\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Verve Wine</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fusualwines.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Usual Wines</strong></a><strong>: </strong>Usual Wines' single-serving beaker bottles are certainly eye-catching and memorable. However, the company only offers its subscriptions in red, ros&#233;, and brut, and these wines don't change month-to-month. On the plus side, its wines contain no added sugars or sulfites, and the grapes come from sustainable farms. If you're looking for a straightforward subscription you don't really have to think about, Usual Wines is a good candidate. Otherwise, our picks above provide better opportunities for education and discovery.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.ackerwines.com/wine-club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Acker Wines</strong></a><strong>: </strong>Acker has wine clubs for a variety of budgets and levels of enthusiasm, from the $89/month Access Club to the $999/month JK Club for fine and rare wines. Acker's Access Club seems promising for wine amateurs, but it's geographically limited to New York City residents. The next club level up jumps to $299/quarter for three bottles, which may be inaccessible for many shoppers.&#160;&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.elicit.wine/eli/subscribe/5637201576.c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Elicit Wine Project</strong></a><strong>: </strong>Elicit Wine Project helps incubate and launch cool, innovative wine brands, so if you're tired of seeing the same stuffy labels, you'll like shopping here and putting together your own subscription box. The downside is that there aren't many varietals to choose from right now. Perhaps as the service grows, we'll see a better variety.&#160;</p>\n\tWhat we look forward to testing\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4ced282c500018c7969d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Verve Wines\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Verve Wine</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://grandtourwine.com/products/wine-club-subscription\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>The Grand Tour</strong></a><strong>: </strong>This club by online and brick-and-mortar shop Verve Wine takes a geographic approach to wine discovery by highlighting four bottles (usually two red and two white) from a different region each month. Why does the region matter? Well, soil, climate, and topography all affect the winemaking process and the final product.&#160;&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.thesipsociety.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>The Sip</strong></a><strong>: </strong>This Black-owned bi-monthly subscription service focuses exclusively on sparkling wines for all your bubbly needs. In addition to three flights of luxury sparkling wine, you'll get priority access to new wine releases. It's the perfect wine club for people who are always looking for an excuse to celebrate.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.mummnapa.com/clubvivant\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Club Vivant</strong></a><strong>: </strong>Another sparkling wine club to consider comes from the beautiful vineyards of Mumm Napa, and features the winery's annual releases and limited-production bottles. The member benefits are numerous, from discounts to preferred seating and monthly complimentary tastings at the winery. Unfortunately, at the time of this update, Mumm Napa is being affected by the California wildfires, but we look forward to testing&#160; Club Vivant soon.</p>\n\tWine FAQs\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4e28282c500018c796a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wine FAQs\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2>How to store wine</h2><p>Do: Lay the bottle on its side in a cool dark place, preferably in a cabinet lower to the floor.&#160;</p><p>Don't: Stand it up on the counter or leave it in direct sunlight.&#160;</p><p>Do: Store your opened bottle in a wine fridge so it can keep a little longer.&#160;</p><p>Don't: Store wine in a regular refrigerator. \"The same qualities that keep your food fresh will not have the same effect on your wine,\" says Price. See our guide to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-fridge\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best wine coolers and fridges</a>.&#160;</p><h2>How to taste wine</h2><p>Go slow and use the right techniques. \"Tasting wine to learn something about it is different from just knocking a glass back casually with friends,\" said Price. \"Take the time to think about what you are tasting. Make sure you stick your nose in the glass and really smell the wine. When you drink it, coat your entire palate. After you swallow, think about how long the flavors and textures linger in your mouth.\"&#160;</p><p>The sommelier and wine writer also recommended starting a tasting group with your friends or family. \"Pick a theme and have everyone bring a bottle within that theme. For example, if you want to understand Syrah, the line-up should include a <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Fguigal-crozes-hermitage-2017%2F622698%3F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Northern Rh&#244;ne</a> (FR), <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Ftorbreck-woodcutters-shiraz-2018%2F548615\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Barossa Valley</a> (AU), <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Fstark-conde-stellenbosch-syrah-2015%2F301669\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Stellenbosch </a>(ZA), <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Fterry-hoage-three-four-syrah-2015%2F588602\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Paso Robles</a> (US), and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Ftenimenti-dalessandro-il-bosco-syrah-2013%2F657737\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Tuscany</a> (IT) bottling amongst others. Each person should bring their bottle wrapped so you can't see the label (don't forget to take the neck foil off, that one is an easy giveaway!), and put the wines out for everyone to taste and guess which wine is which. It's helpful to write your tasting notes down so you see how you progress over time. The entertainment value goes up even more when afterward you discuss your impressions as a group, enjoying the wines you brought with friends.\"</p><h2>How to choose the perfect wine for a gift&#160;</h2><p>Make it personal. \"The best way to gift a bottle of wine is to know a little piece about the recipient. Whether it's a birth year or wedding vintage, a favorite place, or just their personal taste, those small things will make a gifted bottle of wine far more special,\" says Hamburger.&#160;&#160;</p>\n\tCheck out other related guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2d9a2f0f41970df38b3a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wine Tasting Class\" height=\"819\" width=\"1092\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Coursera</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-glass\">The best wine glasses</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-opener-corkscrew\">The best wine openers and corkscrews</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-fridge\">The best wine coolers and fridges</a></li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a ://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8dHXXgj-KAk:EGA7r_bDsPw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn98@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-757_ea9a55faea5468ee.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8dHXXgj-KAk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn68@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-25-047_88662b73c31bc969.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360892},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Joe Biden says he will hold a solo town hall after Trump backed out of the next debate","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-solo-town-hall-trump-backed-out-virtual-presidential-debate-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f3badc655f6001969ef6d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joe Biden \" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Joe Biden, the Democratic presidential nominee.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Former Vice President Joe Biden's campaign team said on Thursday, after President Donald Trump backed out of the next debate, that Biden would do a solo town hall.</li>\n<li>ABC News is set to host the town hall in Philadelphia on October 15.</li>\n<li>After the Commission on Presidential Debates announced earlier Thursday that the next debate would be held virtually, Trump, who has COVID-19, said he wouldn't do it.</li>\n<li>After Biden's announcement, the president's campaign called for the second debate to be moved back to October 22 and for the third to be held on October 29.</li>\n<li>Biden's team shot back, saying that \"Trump's erratic behavior does not allow him to rewrite the calendar.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Former Vice President Joe Biden's campaign team announced on Thursday that he would do a solo town hall on October 15 instead of participating in the next presidential debate.</p><p>ABC News is <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ABC/status/1314279438398431232\">set to host the town hall</a> in Philadelphia, with George Stephanopoulos as the moderator.</p><p>\"Joe Biden was prepared to accept the CPD's proposal for a virtual Town Hall, but the President has refused, as Donald Trump clearly does not want to face questions from the voters about his failures on COVID and the economy,\" the Biden campaign <a href=\"https://twitter.com/edokeefe/status/1314229045865873416\">said in a statement</a>.\" As a result, Joe Biden will find an appropriate place to take questions from voters directly on October 15th, as he has done on several occasions in recent weeks.\"</p><p>Biden's campaign expressed hope that the commission would move the town hall to October 22 so that President Donald Trump \"is not able to evade accountability.\"</p><p>\"The voters should have a chance to ask questions of both candidates, directly. Every presidential candidate since 1992 has participated in such an event, and it would be a shame if Donald Trump was the first to refuse,\" the statement added.</p><p>The Commission on Presidential Debates had announced earlier Thursday that the next debate would be virtual \"to protect the health and safety of all involved.\" Trump, who is still being treated for COVID-19, backed out.</p><p>\"I'm not going to waste my time on a virtual debate. That's not what debating's all about,\" Trump <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-covid-status-rambling-fox-business-interview-bartiromo-2020-10\">said in an interview</a> with Fox Business Network on Thursday morning. \"You sit behind a computer and do a debate — it's ridiculous.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Aaron Rupar  (@atrupar) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1314174756430774273?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 8, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The Trump campaign said the president would instead hold a rally.</p><p>The president has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-first-debate-strategy-wasted-time-biden-2020-9\">trailed Biden</a> by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/polling-suggests-trump-chances-of-defeating-biden-rapidly-dwindling-2020-10\">significant margins</a> in national polls and in recent polling in battleground states. The decision to opt out of a virtual debate denies Trump exposure to millions of voters with Election Day just weeks away.</p><p>After Biden's announcement on Thursday, the president's campaign also called for the debate to be moved back to October 22 and for the third debate, originally scheduled for October 22, to be moved back a week, to October 29.</p><p>In <a href=\"https://twitter.com/KellyO/status/1314241133791391745\">a statement</a>, Trump's campaign manager, Bill Stepien, baselessly accused the commission of attempting to give Biden an advantage via a virtual debate.</p><p>\"As President Trump said, a virtual debate is a non-starter and would clearly be a gift to Biden,\" Stepien said.</p><p>Polls found that Biden <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/trump-biden-debate-poll/\">got much higher marks than Trump</a> for his performance in the first debate, on September 29, two days before the president was diagnosed with COVID-19.</p><p>Later Thursday, the Biden campaign pushed back on the Trump campaign's suggestion to reschedule both debates.</p><p>\"Trump's erratic behavior does not allow him to rewrite the calendar, and pick new dates of his choosing,\" Kate Bedingfield, Biden's deputy campaign manager, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/sahilkapur/status/1314252287242579971?s=20\">said in a statement</a>.</p><p>The campaigns' back-and-forth puts the next two debates in question with time running out before the election.</p><p><em>This article has been updated.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-solo-town-hall-trump-backed-out-virtual-presidential-debate-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=LkoGXA9vTtE:RUJ4QslRcwo:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=LkoGXA9vTtE:RUJ4QslRcwo:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>The right workout clothes keep inconveniences like overheating, wet patches, and chafing at bay.&#160;<br></strong></li><li><strong>The best workout apparel brands are a combination of high-performance technical materials, smart engineering, and versatile style.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>We recommend <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&awinaffid=257137&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fwomen%2Fwomen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Nike</a>'s workout gear for women overall, as it's the best blend of price, performance, and variety. But, we also highly recommend the other brands on this list, some of which cater to individual needs better.</strong></li></ul><p>Working out often forces us to feel discomfort. We're hot, sweaty, tired, and, though we're not exactly sure, we think we're beginning to feel the onset of shin splints.</p><p>But the right activewear gear makes all the difference. It inhibits nuisances like chafing, wet spots, heat-trapping, blisters, and sometimes injuries. At a baseline, it reduces the number of unnecessary challenges so we can focus on the task at hand. Ideally, it helps us push ourselves a little further, and perform a little better. But, in general, it should simply make the act of moving a more enjoyable experience.</p><p>Below, we've ranked the best workout brands to shop based on Insider Reviews' own testing. Each one excels in gear that's functional, stylish, and performs well. The individual brands offer a variety of strengths: eco-friendly practices, comfortable athleisure, styles that can transition from yoga to the office, greater size ranges, and more inclusive options to name a few.&#160;</p><p><em>Updated 10/5/2020 by Maria Del Russo: Updated links, checked prices, and added Everlane and ADAY to our \"brands we also considered\" slide. Removed our \"best workout clothes you can wear all day\" slide.</em></p><h2>Here are the best workout clothes for women in 2020:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best workout clothes sponsored\">Athleta</a></strong></li><li><strong> Best athleisure workout clothes: <a class=\"copyright\">Nike</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fwomen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nike</a> caters to pretty much every sport with a variety of inclusive styles, making it our top pick for high-performance workout gear.&#160;</h3><p>Nike has the best balance of price, performance, and variety in its workout gear. A pair of leggings can go for upwards of $70, but you can find plenty of $40-$60 options, and the site semi-frequently offers discounts. Nike items also have a good price-per-wear breakdown thanks to an expert handle on performance engineering and technical materials across categories.</p><p>There's something for athletes of pretty much every sport: running, golf, soccer, training, tennis, basketball, softball, skateboarding, swim, and lacrosse &#8212; and all different types of gear, from <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fw%2Fwomens-running-shoes-37v7jz5e1x6zy7ok\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">women's running shoes</a> to <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fw%2Fwomens-surf-swimwear-5e1x6zq3un\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">swimwear</a> and <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fw%2Fwomens-compression-baselayer-4pwbz5e1x6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">compression layers</a>. And they've expanded their activewear to have more inclusive sizes (from XS to 3X) and styles (for example, high-performance <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fw%3Fq%3Dhijab%26vst%3Dhijab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">hijab options</a>).&#160;</p><p><strong>What to buy:</strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e7a68e72d41c1262a0de9e6\" style=\"position:relative; Plus, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/athleta-contender-line-review-2019-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">we liked the company's leggings</a> quite a bit during testing. It also has a wide variety of activewear. Currently, it stocks gear for the following activities: yoga/studio, hike, commute/travel, and run/train. And you may get lucky with frequent discounts, so it's always worth checking the <a href=\"https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fathleta.gap.com%2Fbrowse%2Fcategory.do%3Fcid%3D1023728%26mlink%3D44913%2C17610101%2CtopNav_Sale%2Cvisnav%26clink%3D17610101\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">sale section</a> first.&#160;</p><p>However, head-to-head, Nike's products have a slight edge when it comes to performance and comfort in our experience. we put it to the test</a></li></ul></ul></section>\n\tThe best athleisure workout gear\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a871a48d030721e008b4793?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Patagonia womens\" height=\"723\" width=\"964\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Patagonia</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>For pieces that perform&#160;<em>and&#160;</em>are stylish enough to wear anywhere, you'll want to check out <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fb%2Fpatagonia\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Patagonia</a>.&#160;</h3><p>Aside from creating one of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/patagonia-leggings-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best pairs of athleisure leggings</a> we've ever tested, Patagonia makes one of the mainstream culture's crown jewels of comfort: the <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3DSynchilla%2BSnap-T%2BFleece%2BPullover\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Synchilla Snap-T Fleece Pullover</a>. And whether you're a fan of the label and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/patagonia-un-champions-of-the-earth-award-2019\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">what it stands for</a> or you couldn't care less, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/patagonia-quilt-snap-t-pullover-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the brand's quality and comfort speak for itself</a>.&#160;</p><p>We trust Patagonia as much for form as we do for function. And while its prices aren't the least (or most) expensive on the market, you'll get a wide variety of items, a product that's built to last, and the security of a generous return policy <a href=\"https://help.patagonia.com/s/article/Return-Policy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">without a tight time limit</a>. It's also a big perk that the company is a B Corp, has donated 1% of its profit to environmental organizations since the '80s, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/patagonia-un-champions-of-the-earth-award-2019\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">won the&#160;UN's Champions of the Earth award</a>&#160;for entrepreneurial vision.</p><p>You may get lucky with a seasonal Patagonia sale, but you'll probably only see discounts on its bestsellers &#8212; like the <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3DSynchilla%2BSnap-T%2BFleece%2BPullover\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Synchilla Snap-T Fleece Pullover</a> &#8212; we unanimously agreed that they're some of the best we've ever worn</a></li></ul>\n\tThe best size-inclusive workout clothes:\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e7a49f62d41c10e1f16a54e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ls easy active tee_heather charcoal_USAT0626_21820_041_2048x\" height=\"1536\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Universal Standard</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With sizes ranging from 00-40, <a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Universal Standard</a>&#160;has set the, well, <em>standard</em> for inclusive sizing in workout clothing.&#160;</h3><p>Universal Standard is the place to go for cool, high-quality closet staples available in sizes 00-40. They also tend to offer items in regular, tall, and petite lengths. We love the company's clothes because they're comfortable and high-performing &#8212; but we're equally invested in its commitment to making clothes for more people than the industry currently serves, especially since the <a href=\"https://www.byrdie.com/average-body-weight\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">average American woman is between size 16 to 18</a>.</p><p>If you buy a piece from the core collection and, in the future, it no longer fits due to size fluctuation, the company has a <a href=\"https://imp.i240138.net/c/196318/786259/11299?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.universalstandard.com%2Fpages%2Ffit-liberty\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Universal Fit Liberty</a> policy that lets you replace it with your new size, within a year of purchase, free of charge.&#160;</p><p>However, Universal Standard doesn't have the most expansive selection, and sometimes stock can be limited in certain bestsellers.&#160;</p><h3><strong>What to buy:&#160;</strong></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5e67dd23e4f9fe6f446434b5\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e67dd23e4f9fe6f446434b5&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e67dd8984159f6f023b3d27\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e67dd8984159f6f023b3d27&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5f7e0a6f0afbe723ae2d7b76\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f7e0a6f0afbe723ae2d7b76&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><h3>Read more about Universal Standard:</h3><section></section><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/universal-standard-denim-jeans-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">7 women tried Universal Standard's size-inclusive line of jeans that goes from 00 to 40 &#8212; here's the verdict</a><section></section></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/universal-standard-foundation-collection-clothing-review-2018-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Women's clothing company Universal Standard has launched an inclusive line of basics offered in sizes 00 to 40</a></li></ul>\n\tBest splurge-worthy workout clothes\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e7a4a782d41c10f344d6342?format=jpeg\" alt=\"image   2020 03 24T125740.293\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lululemon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>You won't have to justify splurging when you buy your workout gear from <a href=\"https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.lululemon.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Lululemon</a>. Its styles are created with longevity in mind, which means you'll save in the long run.</h3><p>Lululemon is home to some of the best gear for yoga, running, training, and sweating. Its gear is pricey &#8212; a pair of plain <a href=\"https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.lululemon.com%2Fp%2Fwomen-pants%2FWunder-Under-HR-Tight-Full-Lux%2F_%2Fprod8330011%3Fcolor%3D43632\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">black leggings</a> can go for nearly $100 &#8212; but the comfort, utility, longevity, and style give it an edge that makes a higher upfront cost justifiable if you can comfortably make the splurge. We've found ourselves wearing every piece on repeat, bringing the cost per wear down to something far more manageable.&#160;</p><h3><strong>What to buy:&#160;</strong></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5e67d7c484159f63fc607937\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e67d7c484159f63fc607937&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e62cd5ffee23d222d686592\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e62cd5ffee23d222d686592&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e0a4547855cc275f6076a46\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e0a4547855cc275f6076a46&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><h3>Read more about Lululemon:</h3><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lululemon-down-for-it-all-jacket-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">This lightweight down jacket is my go-to for winter workouts &#8212; plus it's just tailored enough to wear casually</a></li></ul>\n\tBest eco-friendly workout clothes\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bd21a3897b3c522b424b54d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Girlfriend Collective\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Girlfriend Collective Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With its size-inclusive styles and priority toward sustainability, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=43051&#38;u1=biipgf_011019_best-athleisure-women&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.girlfriend.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Girlfriend Collective</a> provides workout gear you can feel good about wearing.&#160;</h3><p>Girlfriend Collective has some of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/girlfriend-collective-leggings-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best leggings we've ever worn</a>, and we appreciate the brand's color variety, relatively low price points, and inclusive size range. We also like that Girlfriend Collective currently offers versatility in its colors &#8212; 14 total (five essential, and nine limited-edition) &#8212; and sizing (it's available in three inseam lengths and sizes XXS-6XL) in its <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=43051&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.girlfriend.com%2Fproducts%2Fblack-compressive-high-rise-legging%3Futm_source%3DRAN%26utm_medium%3Daffiliate%26utm_campaign%3DBusiness%2BInsider%26ranMID%3D43051%26ranEAID%3DEHFxW6yx8Uo%26ranSiteID%3DEHFxW6yx8Uo-zX11m4f_3UBZHscykuGBog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow\">bestselling leggings</a>. However, we wouldn't recommend wearing these leggings to a hot yoga class or HIIT given their thickness.&#160;</p><p>Another perk is that the company prioritizes sustainability in its materials and processes. Its packaging is 100% recyclable, its compression leggings are made of 79% recycled polyester from 25 post-consumer water bottles, and its Cupro tees are made from 100% cupro, a fiber made from the waste of the cotton industry. And, while cupro saves a reported 682 gallons of water compared to cotton, the company also pledged to donate 10% of its net profits to Charity Water to offset any water usage that may occur during production.</p><p>However, slow fashion that's also in high demand can lead to stock outages, and Girlfriend Collective doesn't always have what we want available. We also wish it had a larger selection.</p><h3><strong>What to buy:&#160;</strong></h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5e14b282f442310681133ec4\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e14b282f442310681133ec4&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e67df7c54f25c6dc04a6e74\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e67df7c54f25c6dc04a6e74&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h3>Read more about Girlfriend Collective:</h3><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/girlfriend-collective-leggings-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The internet can't stop talking about these leggings made of recycled water bottles &#8212; and now I understand why</a><br /><section></section></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/girlfriend-collective-shirt-review-2018-06\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The athleisure startup that once gave away free leggings over the internet is now making the most comfortable workout shirts &#8212; they breathe like cotton but feel like silk</a></li></ul>\n\tBrands we also considered\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5be09b43e4218a1b9930ffce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"janji, $64\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Janji</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We also considered the following brands for this guide but, for the reasons listed below, didn't rank them officially. We still recommend them.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=91718&#38;urllink=www.tracksmith.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Tracksmith</a></strong></p><p><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=91718&#38;urllink=www.tracksmith.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Tracksmith</a> makes exceptional and versatile running gear &#8212; including some of the <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=91718&#38;urllink=www.tracksmith.com%2Fproducts%2Fw-ndo-tights-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">best temperature-regulating leggings</a> and <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=91718&#38;urllink=www.tracksmith.com%2Fproducts%2Fw-waffle-layer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">layers</a> that I've tested. But, they tend to be pretty expensive (its <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=91718&#38;urllink=www.tracksmith.com%2Fproducts%2Fw-van-cortlandt-singlet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Singlet</a> is $65, and <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=91718&#38;urllink=www.tracksmith.com%2Fproducts%2Fw-ndo-tights-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">NDO Running Tights</a> are $148), and their running-focused inventory isn't as diverse as other options on this list.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e7a66bfba85ee228b662944\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e7a66bfba85ee228b662944&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/stores/2XU/2XU/page/B72D38BD-A681-4D6A-9133-1AACE1EAD0BA/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=sl2&#38;tag=biip_051417_2xu-tights-20&#38;linkId=bc27d6543745b761bff7fbfa748bed1c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">2XU</a></strong></p><p>I count <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/stores/2XU/2XU/page/B72D38BD-A681-4D6A-9133-1AACE1EAD0BA/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=sl2&#38;tag=biip_051417_2xu-tights-20&#38;linkId=bc27d6543745b761bff7fbfa748bed1c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">2XU</a> as the creator of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2xu-compression-leggings-tights-review-2018-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best and most breathable compressive running tights</a> that I've ever found, but its prices are high across categories (the tights go for <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/2XU-Womens-Compression-Tights-Medium/dp/B01IFMD6S2/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;qid=1526501479&#38;sr=8-2&#38;keywords=2Xu+mcs+run+tight+women&#38;linkCode=sl1&#38;tag=biip_051417_2xu-tights-20&#38;linkId=3f6678aaf893803d028c8b749a1d3fac\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">$120 on Amazon</a>) with few sales, and the company has fewer categories and offerings than other generalist brands.&#160;&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d9f88e4cc4a0a01fd6daf8a\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d9f88e4cc4a0a01fd6daf8a&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=387479ac-c616-472a-bb5e-037f5cdfae7d&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Frunjanji.com%2F&#38;ctc=1585069583672ayvgalcdy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\">Janji</a></strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=387479ac-c616-472a-bb5e-037f5cdfae7d&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Frunjanji.com%2F&#38;ctc=1585069583672ayvgalcdy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\">Janji</a> also makes some of the best workout gear I've ever tested &#8212; in particular, its short-sleeve T-shirts and windbreaker running jacket. And while the company is running-specific, its gear transitions well to other activities. But this also means the company doesn't have a very diverse range of products. Still, I highly recommend shopping here. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/janji-running-clothes-review-2018-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The company also has a social mission</a>, and while prices on average are a little high, the price-per-wear has been great in our experience.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e7a64ec0c2a62594561e9ad\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e7a64ec0c2a62594561e9ad&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><strong><a href=\"http://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGRk5HSUJGSEhLR01CRkxFTkpN?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aloyoga.com%2F&#38;sid=1585245342092al5ejz8t7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Alo Yoga</a></strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alo-yoga-airlift-leggings-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">We loved Alo's Airlift Leggings</a> in our testing, but we can't confidently say all of its pieces warrant their relatively high prices &#8212; though we've already found a handful of standouts. And the company carries less diverse inventory than most of the brands mentioned here.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e67d977e4f9fe67fd64e404\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e67d977e4f9fe67fd64e404&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TEFNS0VFQUVHR0pGTEFFREhLRE0?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.everlane.com%2Fcollections%2Fwomens-perform\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Everlane</a></strong></p><p>With just four styles, <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TEFNS0VFQUVHR0pGTEFFREhLRE0?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.everlane.com%2Fcollections%2Fwomens-perform\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Everlane's activewear selection</a> is on the smaller side &#8212; so we didn't give them a top spot on this list. That said, the brand's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everlane-perform-leggings-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Perform Leggings</a> rank as some of the most comfortable leggings we've ever worn. They're on the thinner side, which means they aren't sturdy enough for high-intensity workouts, but the Perform Leggings are great for yoga and pilates.&#160;&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e31fe8024306a21c7192702\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e31fe8024306a21c7192702&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><strong><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=63261&#38;urllink=www.thisisaday.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">ADAY</a></strong></p><p>ADAY used to be our pick for \"best workout clothes you can wear all day.\" And while we love the brand's stylish leggings and tops, the lack of performance styles it offers made it tough to keep on this list. We still highly recommend ADAY, though, especially if you're looking for the <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-leggings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best leggings you can buy</a>.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f7e0b97bf96b906670778de\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe Leighton)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5e7cd364487c225a8103b724?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn1@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-28-555_63ca22a518d7f34e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e7a34dd0c2a6239a072bfdb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-28-990_cd5b711c6df03019.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e712230c4854052790af6c3?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5a871a48d030721e008b4793?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-34-939_0299610ae7899161.webp","https://i.insider.com/5c4b84342bdd7f244406690c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn97@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-24-569_6c44c53d28a16f2e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e7a49f62d41c10e1f16a54e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn59@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-24-168_c0ebfadfc14d234b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e7a4a782d41c10f344d6342?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn98@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-26-836_ba2ea9c1c2684c77.webp","https://i.insider.com/5bd21a3897b3c522b424b54d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn16@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-31-704_f91d92ea823fa709.webp","https://i.insider.com/5be09b43e4218a1b9930ffce?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn71@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-33-522_d89c3585918d3959.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zoxxtpAPhQA:Q9O7Sza-dNE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn17@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-33-079_40e034c9aea36695.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zoxxtpAPhQA:Q9O7Sza-dNE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-26-179_c1f260fb18d13d57.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zoxxtpAPhQA:Q9O7Sza-dNE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn33@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-30-466_03c26b23e55d6df9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/zoxxtpAPhQA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn100@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-30-682_9d1e450d4946898c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360914},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"A 35-year-old US Navy sailor who used military perks to 'house-hack' his way to passive income explains his strategy","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-navy-sailor-military-perks-buy-investment-property-2020-10","description":"<div class=\"content-header\"><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/master-your-money\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://media.tbistatic.com/bistudios/_00/dev_edit/mym/banner/MYM_banner.png?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Master your Money - presented by Fidelity Investments\" height=\"\" width=\"\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p></div><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5aa0ca7ed0ee001e25eaf8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Damazo\" height=\"846\" width=\"1128\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mike Damazo and his wife, Grace.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Mike Damazo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Mike Damazo is a petty officer in the US Navy stationed in Japan.</li>\n<li>Over the past seven years, he's used military benefits to invest in real estate.</li>\n<li>Damazo \"house-hacked\" a home he bought outside Fresno, California, using income from renters and his own military housing allowance to cover the mortgage.</li>\n<li>He also owns a townhouse in San Diego, which he purchased for 0% down using a Veterans Affairs loan and hopes to sell for a profit.</li>\n<li>This article is part of a series focused on millennial financial empowerment called <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/master-your-money\">Master your Money</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Mike Damazo joined the Navy at 18, but he knew he wanted to own real estate even earlier.</p><p>Growing up in New Jersey, Damazo remembers watching his uncles flip homes for a profit and his mother's and stepfather's desire to buy a house of their own. But when a family member was deported to the Philippines, they moved back there too.</p><p>\"I just remember that family home being kind of taken away from me,\" Damazo, a 35-year-old petty officer stationed in Japan, told Business Insider. \"It was so nice the house in Jersey, and that was the motivation for me to be like, 'OK, I am going to own property, and I'm going to be able to take care of my mom.'\"</p><h2><strong>Years of overspending pushed real estate out of reach</strong></h2><p>It wasn't easy, Damazo realized. Stationed in San Diego for the Navy, he found himself \"spending lavishly to keep up with the Joneses,\" he said. He racked up tens of thousands of dollars in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/how-to-pay-off-credit-card-debt\">credit card</a>, auto, and personal-loan debt.</p><p>\"I feel like it was a total of 10 years of my life, just thinking I had enough money, but really it was just living paycheck to paycheck,\" Damazo said.</p><p>A turning point came when Damazo was on deployment and attended a finance class offered by the military. A high-ranking official he looked up to said they were in a lot worse shape than he was financially. That motivated him to become debt-free.</p><p>But shortly after Damazo was pulled over for driving under the influence, a misdemeanor in San Diego. In 2013 he was sent to a new duty station, in Lamoore, California, a rural town outside Fresno. It was a setback, he said, but coincidentally it helped him fast-track his real-estate dreams.</p><p>\"When I got there, I didn't lose any rank, but I took a deep pay cut just because the cost of living in Fresno was way cheaper than San Diego,\" Damazo said. \"I had to really buckle down and get into the nitty-gritty of my finances.\"</p><h2><strong>House-hacking, with leverage</strong></h2><p>In Lamoore, Damazo rented a single room for $500, took on a second job as a sushi chef, and worked hard to pay off more of his debt. Within a year he bought his first property.</p><p>\"I was looking at the housing market and I noticed houses that were 1,300 square feet and cheaper than in San Diego,\" he said. After years of yearning to buy a property in the more expensive coastal market but unable to afford it, the time was finally right in Lemoore.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f621c7257b7da001ee11eb2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Damazo Fresno\" height=\"1536\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mike Damazo at his rental property in Lemoore, California.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mike Damazo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The house, a foreclosure, cost $165,000. He took out a <a href=\"https://eligibility.sc.egov.usda.gov/eligibility/welcomeAction.do\">USDA loan</a>, available to eligible homebuyers in mostly rural areas, and bought the three-bedroom house with nothing down.&#160;</p><p>The mortgage was $1,100 a month, but Damazo had a plan to cover it, and turn a profit. He rented out the two biggest rooms to fellow service members, for a total of $900 a month, and lived in the smallest room himself.</p><p>In the real-estate investment world it's called <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/own-my-home-not-house-hacking-live-for-free\">house-hacking</a>, whereby the owner of a single-family home or multi-unit building lives in the smallest and usually cheapest room or unit, and collects rent from the others.</p><p>Damazo was also collecting from the military. He was getting a basic allowance for housing, known as BAH, of about $900 a month added to his paycheck. The amount is tied to a person's rank, marriage and dependency status, and pay, and is based on local rental market prices.</p><p>Damazo needed to put only $400 toward housing costs, $200 to cover the remaining balance on the mortgage, and $200 into a cash reserve for home maintenance. The rest was his to keep.</p><h2><strong>Building home equity in San Diego</strong></h2><p>Two years later, Damazo got orders from the Navy to return to San Diego. He transitioned the Lemoore property into a full rental and hired a property manager. He pays them 8% of the total rental income — now $1,450 a month — to handle landlording duties and keep an eye out for other real-estate investment deals in the area. Damazo said he pockets about $200 a month after expenses.</p><p>Within six months of moving back to San Diego, he was snatching up more real estate. This time he used a Veterans Affairs loan, which allows eligible active-duty service members to buy with no down payment and no <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/what-is-private-mortgage-insurance-definition-cost\">mortgage insurance</a>, and lock in a lower interest rate. Damazo purchased a $350,000 townhouse with nothing down in La Jolla, a tony beach community.</p><p>He and his wife, Grace, lived in the one-bedroom home instead of renting it out, but his housing allowance had been bumped up to $3,000 a month after returning to San Diego. That left him with yet another surplus after paying his monthly mortgage and homeowners' association totaling $2,050.</p><p>Damazo put the townhouse up for sale this summer, when he relocated to Japan. He's hoping to make a profit so he can parlay his earnings into a new investment property, he said, possibly in Texas, where real estate is cheaper.</p><p>For now he's hanging on to the rental property in Lemoore, armed with an exit plan to sell if his costs exceed income generated from tenants.</p><h2><strong>It's just the beginning</strong></h2><p>\"The goal is eight properties, passive income, and just being able to keep it up,\" said Damazo, who runs a YouTube channel called \"<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnJxw7QrJMG9vNAaci8qM-A/videos\">Fitness Wealth</a>,\" where he talks about his own journey to building wealth, shares personal-finance advice, and interviews experts.</p><p>His advice to fellow service members looking to get into real-estate investment is to take advantage of the monthly housing allowance from the military by living below their means.&#160;</p><p>For those who don't have military perks available but are interested in real-estate investing, be patient, he said.</p><p>\"Patience is the biggest thing for someone just starting off,\" Damazo said. \"It's easy to kind of watch and read other people's stories of being so much more of a success in real estate, but just remember that this is your story and you're in your lane. Just take it slow and look for the right deal. And always have an exit strategy, no matter what.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/us-navy-sailor-military-perks-buy-investment-property-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Loudenback)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://media.tbistatic.com/bistudios/_00/dev_edit/mym/banner/MYM_banner.png?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn4@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-32-968_18839599776e6e12.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5aa0ca7ed0ee001e25eaf8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn22@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-32-57-887_02b07399f08d207d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f621c7257b7da001ee11eb2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn51@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-31-096_d9d813c71481c8fa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3uDPpRxwOzE:t_PMG9b50pM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn57@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-24-963_48d7301f46a00a68.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3uDPpRxwOzE:t_PMG9b50pM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn79@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-34-129_268e5f72a9e4eb48.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-30-246_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3uDPpRxwOzE:t_PMG9b50pM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn59@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-26-062_74722ba5f04c12af.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/3uDPpRxwOzE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn67@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-35-477_c8289d6bfe19abb8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214360906},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:32:40","title":"Sacha Baron Cohen just slammed Facebook for being a home for conspiracy theories that could 'kill democracy as we know it'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/sacha-baron-cohen-slams-facebook-conspiracy-theories-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f5796e4029f001876056d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sasha baron cohen\" height=\"1331\" width=\"1774\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sacha Baron Cohen attends the 71st Emmy Awards at Microsoft Theater on September 22, 2019 in Los Angeles, California.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/FilmMagic</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Actor Sacha Baron Cohen wrote an op-ed for Time condemning social media platforms for allowing misinformation to spread, and he singled out Facebook in particular.</li>\n<li>The \"Borat\" actor, who has come out hard against Facebook before, said the company is a \"dutiful ally\" to President Donald Trump and attacked the firm for its failure to fact-check misleading political ads and posts.</li>\n<li>Cohen wrote how the \"trifecta\" of President Trump, Facebook, and the spread of misinformation has created \"a whirlwind of conspiratorial madness\" leading up to the 2020 election that could \"kill democracy as we know it.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Actor Sacha Baron Cohen in an <a href=\"https://time.com/5897501/conspiracy-theory-misinformation/\">op-ed for Time Magazine</a> called for an end to the proliferation of conspiracy theories on social media platforms — and the actor zeroed in on Facebook specifically.</p><p>The actor slammed the company for the role it has played in misinformation spreading online, calling out Facebook's algorithm that is designed to promote content that more people find interesting. Cohen also called Facebook out for its refusal to fact-check political ads and remove misleading posts.</p><p>The actor pointed out that conspiracy theories are more easily spread during times of uncertainty.</p><p>\"Donald Trump — who averages <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/07/13/president-trump-has-made-more-than-20000-false-or-misleading-claims/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">23 lies a day</a> and is the world's greatest superspreader of coronavirus conspiracies —has caught the virus himself. He has a dutiful ally in Facebook — the greatest propaganda machine in history. And this is a time when Americans are especially vulnerable to lies and conspiracies. This trifecta has created a whirlwind of conspiratorial madness,\" Cohen wrote in the op-ed.</p><p>Cohen's damning remarks come as the 2020 presidential election looms just weeks away and as social media sites continue to grapple with policing disinformation on their platforms. Facebook has been in the spotlight specifically for giving QAnon networks a platform. The baseless far-right conspiracy theory spouts the claim that President Trump is secretly fighting a \"deep state\" group of human traffickers. Its scores of supporters found a home on Facebook up until Tuesday when the company said it was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/qanon-banned-from-facebook-dealing-massive-blow-to-conspiracy-group-2020-10\">banning QAnon from its platform.</a>&#160;</p><p>This isn't the first time Cohen has come out as a staunch opponent of Facebook. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sacha-baron-cohen-adl-speech-mark-zuckerberg-silicon-valley-2019-11\">The actor slammed the company</a> — and other Silicon Valley giants — in late 2019 for what he says is the firm's failure to stop the spread of lies and hate speech.</p><p>In January of this year, the actor attacked Zuckerberg in a Twitter post, calling the CEO out for a series of political ads the firm allowed to run on the site that a Guardian investigation found to be riddled with disinformation. \"Mark Zuckerberg, history will judge you harshly — if we still have historians after you help destroy democracy,\" Cohen wrote in the <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SachaBaronCohen/status/1222571095905243137\">tweet.</a></p><p>Zuckerberg said he does not wish Facebook to be an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-twitter-facebook-no-fact-check-mark-zuckerberg-fox-news-2020-5\">\"arbiter of truth\"</a>&#160;after Twitter opted to attach a warning label to a tweet posted by President Donald Trump in which he falsely stated that \"there is NO WAY (ZERO!) that Mail-In Ballots will be anything less than substantially fraudulent.\"</p><p>Facebook's reputation has been tarnished since its handling of user data came to light in the Cambridge Analytica scandal, as well as its involvement in the 2016 presidential election. The social media firm has rolled out a series of moves leading up to this year's election in an effort to stunt the spread of misinformation on the platform.</p><p>In September, Zuckerberg said Facebook would start&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-will-label-trump-early-victory-official-election-results-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"13d692d0e66cd09b36f8d33312d1e52c\">labeling posts from candidates</a> that declare victory before the official results can be counted. With the influx of mail-in ballots, it's possible that the nation will not know the election results until after November 3. Facebook also announced it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-removing-posts-with-content-that-seeks-to-intimidate-voters-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"57607c6a178224105806300c92366747\">would attach a label</a>&#160;to content that touches on the \"legitimacy of voting methods, for example, by claiming that lawful methods of voting will lead to fraud.\" President Donald Trump has peddled claims that mail-in voting will lead to election fraud.</p><p>The social media firm has also announced that it would&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-says-it-will-ban-all-political-ads-after-election-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"6ede678ce15c5f2a70dd9780133d0190\">not accept political ads</a> starting the day after the election.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/sacha-baron-cohen-slams-facebook-conspiracy-theories-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
